Está iniciando un nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijol, para esto solicita un préstamo que le facilite los recursos y poder obtener el abono y los herbicidas e insecticidas necesarios para prevenir las plagas en el cultivo, esto le ayudará a tener una mayor seguridad de sus siembras agrícolas, con la esperanza de tener una cosecha más abundante.
La aspiración de José es continuar trabajando en la tierra, ya que es una actividad que realiza desde muy joven y que considera necesaria para generar la alimentación a su familia.
texts.en:
José plants corn and beans, an activity which he has done for ten years. He works every day from 6 am to 3 pm. He learned this work from his father, and until now has had no problems. José lives with his wife. They have no children.
He is starting a new crop of corn and beans, for which he is requesting a loan for the resources he needs: fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for preventing plagues. This will help him to have better security and the hope of a more abundant harvest.
José's goal is to keep working the land, since this is an activity he has done from a young age and it is necessary for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ingris Lisseth

texts.es:
Ingris, tiene 22 años de edad vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, quienes son dependientes económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace tres años, Lo atiende a tiempo completo y surgió como una alternativa para mantener una ocupación de la cual pudiera recibir dinero.
Ésta solicitando un préstamo porque necesita realizar la compra de maíz por mayor cantidad, comprándose aproximadamente unos ocho quintales, ya que los puede obtener a un bajo precio, este credito le ayudará con los recursos económicos para que ella pueda obtener la materia prima e incrementar sus ventas de tortillas.
La aspiración de Ingris es apoyar a sus hijos en su crianza y educación, generar un negocio más amplio del cual puedan recibir mejores utilidades que le permitan apoyarles en el necesario.
texts.en:
Ingris, age 22, lives with her husband. She has two children, ages 4 and 8, who are economically dependent. She has sold tortillas for three years. She works full time. This job came about as an option for having a job and making money.
She is requesting a loan because she needs to buy a larger quantity of corn; approximately 8 quintals. This will allow her to get it at a low price. This loan will help her by giving her the economic resources to obtain the basic materials in order to increase her tortilla sales.
Ingris aspires to supporting her children in their growth and education and generating a greater income with which to better provide support for her family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Vilma Gladys

texts.es:
Vilma, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo aprendió desde muy joven junto con sus padres, ya que han sido comerciantes de cerdos, no tiene un horario establecido para atender las labores que demanda la granja, ella vive un nieto, sus hijos ya están separados en sus propios hogares, solamente el nieto depende económicamente de ella.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y luego poderlos poner a la venta, el préstamo le permitirá realizar una buena inversión ya que tiene una oportunidad para crecer en el negocio, también le dará a futuro una mejor ganancia.
Su objetivo es realizar una buena inversión en el negocio, poder tener las oportunidades de venta con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma makes a living raising pigs. She learned this business as a child close to her parents because they had been pig merchants. She does not have a set schedule to attend to the labors that the farm demands. She lives with her grandchild; her children have already moved to their own homes. Her grandchild is the only one who is economically dependent on her. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of pigs to fatten them and then put them on the market. The loan will allow her to carry out a good investment that provides an opportunity to grow her business. It would also give her greater future profits. Her objective is to fulfill a good investment in the business, being able to have sale opportunities with her customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs to bring to the market

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa Juana tiene cuarenta años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Rosa Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, además se dedica a la críanza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra abonos, líquido mata maleza, urea y comprar un cerdo.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la siembra de cacao y podrá comprar un animal. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Babahoyo, San Juan.

El sueño es tener un vehículo. El desafío al que se enfrenta es poder criar a los animales.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa Juana is 40 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and two children in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in San Francisco, in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish.  The group's members work in agriculture.

Rosa Juana's business is raising animals such as hens and pigs.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals.  With the support of this loan, she would like to buy more animals to raise and then sell at a good price.  She makes her purchases in Babahoyo and makes her sales in Babahoyo, Ventanas and San Juan.

Rosa Juana's dream is to not experience any problems in raising her animals.  The difficulty she faces is being able to raise her animals.

In her free time, Rosa Juana takes care of her animals.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, urea and to purchase a pig

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, está casada, y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
La actividad económica de María es la elaboración y venta de tajadas de plátano. Las tajadas las vende empacadas en bolsas y las vende en ristras de manera ambulante en las pulperías o en cualquier negocio de la localidad. Este negocio lo comenzó hace 10 años con la visión de generar sus propios ingresos donde le diera las facilidades de crecer económicamente. Ya que con los prestamos anteriores logro incrementar sus ventas, Por eso trabaja desde muy temprano elaborando su producto para después salir a venderlo.
 Esta solicitando un  préstamo con ODEF de 22,000 lempiras el cual le ayudara a surtir su negocio en compra de insumos para la elaboración de las tajadas como (compra de plátano, aceite, bolsas, grapas, cartoncillo, sal, etc. Y otra parte para reparar una bicicleta para usarla como medio de trasporte para distribuir su producto, facilitándole hacer más rápidas sus ventas.
Su meta a seguir invirtiendo para que su inventario aumente y sacar sus hijos adelante facilitándole que sigan estudiando y darles los recursos necesarios.
texts.en:
María, 32, is married and has three children; she lives with her family in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

María’s economic activity is making and selling fried plantain slices.  She sells them packed in bags and by the bundle from place to place to grocery stores or any other local business.  She started this business ten years ago aiming at earning income of her own that would make it easier for her to grow economically.  Previous loans allowed her to increase sales which is why she starts work very early making her product in order to go out and sell it later.

She’s asking ODEF for a 22,000 lempira loan that will help her stock up on ingredients she needs to make the fried plantain slices (plantain, oil, bags, staples, cardboard, salt, etc.).  She will use another part of it to repair a bicycle to use as a means of transport to distribute her product making her sales quicker and easier.

Her goal is to continue investing so that her inventory will grow and to move her children forward facilitating their schooling and giving them the necessary resources.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and to repair her bicycle.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto de 29 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en la aldea Santa Catarina de Intibucá. Modesto es una persona dedicada a la agricultura, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado con su familia, hace 8 años ha logrado establecer su propia parcela donde produce papas. Donde el vive es una zona apta para la agricultura, en este caso de papa. Le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo y le apoya su esposa. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando su segundo préstamo por la cantidad de 5,500.00 Lempiras y lo va invertir en fertilizantes e insumos para el cultivo de papas y asistencia técnica, con el propósito de mejorar el nivel de producción. Agradece a ODEF y a KIVA por el apoyo brindado, con el primer préstamo le fue bien, pues su cosecha fue buena de allí logro pagar el préstamo sin problemas. Su meta es obtener buenos ingresos para cubrir gastos de alimentación y de educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Modesto, 29, is married and has three children.  He lives in the village of Santa Catarina in Intibucá.  Modesto is a person dedicated to agriculture.  
He’s worked with his family since he was little.  Eight years ago he managed to establish his own field where he grows potatoes.  He lives in a zone that’s apt for agriculture, in this case for potatoes.  He spends most of his time at it and his wife helps him.  He sells his crop in the local market.

He’s asking for his second loan in the amount of 5500 lempiras to buy fertilizer and supplies for the potato crop and also for technical assistance in order to improve production levels.

He thanks ODEF and KIVA for the support provided.  He did very well with his first loan because his harvest was good and from it he was able to repay the loan with no problem.  His goal is to earn good income to cover his children’s food and schooling costs and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his potato crop.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has three school-age children. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband cultivates their rice farm. 

Gemma owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector, raising and harvesting rice for sale. Gemma sells her harvest rice commercially. 

Gemma has been in this business for 22 years and earns approximately 25,300 PHP per month. This is the primary source of income for the family. 

She came to the GDMPC office and requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. Fertilizer is used for the good growth of the rice, so that when it is matured, there is a good-quality harvest.  Gemma plans that her returns will be re-invested back into the business and to double the income she receives, and to buy more land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es: Jairo de 24 años de edad, es originario de Granada, casado, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, padre de 2 hijos que están a su cargo. El inicio su actividad desde muy joven ayudandole a su mama ya que ella se dedicaba al mismo negocio, de donde el fue adquiriendo experiencia y total dominio, luego el se casa, decide independizarse y pone su propio negocio en su casa de habitación a la edad de 22 años siendo este su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda a vender sus productos en los alrededores de la comunidad. Solicita el crédito parar comprar frijoles, arroz y azúcar por quintal, el cual estima será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio, incrementaran sus ventas, generando a la vez mas ingresos. Sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando en su negocio ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con el que ha podido salir adelante, su meta próxima es llegar a tener un segundo negocio que seria una miscelánea para tener otros ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo, age 24, is from Granada. He is married and works as a merchant, selling groceries. He has two children who live with him. He started working at a very young age, helping his mother who worked in the same area. This is where he got his experience and mastery of the business. Later, he married and decided to become independent; he opened his own business in his home at the age of 22. This was his first business, and his wife helps him to sell his products in the areas surrounding the community. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of beans, rice, and sugar by the quinal. He believes that this will be helpful because he will be able to invest in his business and increase his sales, generating more income.
His plan for the future is to keep working in his business, since it is something that he enjoys doing and he has been able to succeed. His next goal is to have a second business, a general store, in order to have another income and to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, and sugar by the quintal.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, tiene 53 años de edad, vive con sus dos nietos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la Universidad, tiene tres hijos que están fuera del hogar y que le ayudan mensualmente para cubrir los gastos de la familia, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y agricultura, trabaja con sus hermanos de lunes a sábado, esto lo aprendió de sus padres y hoy en día le ayuda para poder seguir obteniendo trabajo y ganancias.
Ella solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de semilla de maíz, abono, y la preparación de la tierra, también comprará concentrado para los cerdos, la intención de Martina es contar con lo necesario para poder iniciar la siembra que se acerca, el préstamo le ayudará económicamente para obtener los insumos.
La aspiración de Martina es crecer cada vez en la granja y tener buenos resultados en agricultura, también poder tener mejores resultados en las ventas de estos productos.
texts.en:
Martina is 53 years old, and lives with her grandchildren who are studying at a university. She has three children who no longer live in her home, but who still help with household expenses. She makes a living farming and raising pigs, and she works with her brothers Monday through Saturday. She learned farming techniques from her parents, and those skills help her presently to generate income.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase corn seed and manure, and to prepare her lands for planting. She also plans to purchase feed for her pigs. Martina hopes to  be ready for the upcoming planting season, and this loan will help her financially so that she can acquire the necessary items in time. 

Martina's dream is to grow her farm and produce healthy, good crops, as well as increase her product sales.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, manure, and to prepare her lands for planting.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El señor Cirilo tiene 57 años de edad.  Está casado con la Sra. Bertha y sólo tienen 1 hija menor que estudia en nivel primario de la escuela. Ellos se dedican a la actividad agrícola, que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos. Producen papa, papaliza y oca en un terreno de 4 hectáreas en la comunidad de Santa Isabel; cultivan con rotación de cultivos. Cirilo tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad. Vive con su familia en la comunidad rural Sora Sora a 55 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba; por lo tanto para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero, además de que les piden muchos requisitos; CIDRE IFD tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, y Cirilo nos comenta que necesitaban dinero de urgencia para comprar insumos agrícolas: abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos para la siguiente campaña agrícola. El ahorro que tenían lo prestaron a su hijo para que construya su propia casa, porque estaba viviendo en la casa de su suegra, la que compartían entre varias personas, y vivir en una casa ajena era incómodo para ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Cirilo is 57 years old and married to Sra. Bertha. They have only one young daughter at home, who is in primary school. They are farmers and agriculture is the source of their income. They produce potatoes, papalisa (a tuber) and raise geese on 4 hectares of land in the community of Santa Isabel; they practice crop rotation. Cirilo is very experienced at this work. 

He lives with his family in the rural community of Sora Sora, 55 km. from the city of Cochabamba, consequently it is very difficulty for him to go a bank to request a loan. Moreover you have to fulfill many requirements. Field partner, CIDRE, took the initiative of coming to this rural area and Cirilo notes that he needed money urgently to buy farming supplies: organic fertilizer (chicken manure), potato seed and agrochemical products for the next agricultural cycle. The savings they had they loaned to their son so that he could construct his own house, because he was living in his mother-in-law’s house, which was being shared by several people and living in someone else’s house was uncomfortable for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married. Loida has only one grown dependent. Loida's husband is working abroad. 

Loida owns and operates a retail store at home to support her day-to-day needs. For three years, she has been able to manage the store properly. Every month she receives PHP 13,200 from her business venture. To overlay her financial needs, Loida joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has applied for and was granted a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000. This is her fifth loan cycle. Loida is a good member of the co-operative. 

The loan taken is used to purchase daily use commodities to sell, such as noodles, eggs, salt, vinegar, canned goods, spices, shampoo and more. With the revenue it is feasible to earn, Loida hopes to sustain her livelihood further, and sell more products to increase her regular monthly income.

loans.use: purchase daily use products to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Con 42,000 pesos Yesenia podrá comprar más mercancía para su negocio y hacer algunas reparaciones en el local.
Yesenia es soltera y no tiene hijos, utiliza los ingresos para pagar la universidad. Está estudiando Administración de empresas. A Yesenia le gustan mucho los negocios, así que decisió hace cuatro años abrir su tienda de ropas y accesorios en un área de su casa.
A Yesenia le encantaría en el futuro poder mudar su tienda al área comercial de su pueblo, con un local bien decorado y con escaparates vistosos que atraigan a muchos clientes
texts.en:
With 42,000 DOP Yesenia will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will also be able to make some repairs to her place.

Yesenia is single and does not have children.  She uses her income to pay for the university.  She is studying Business Administration.  Yesenia likes businesses a lot.  That is how she decided, four years ago, to open her clothing and accessory store in an area of her house.

Yesenia would be delighted, in the future, to move her store to a commercial area in her town.  She would like to have a well-decorated place with eye-catching shop windows to attract a lot of customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business and to make some repairs to her place of business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia tiene 66 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive con sus hijos en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Alicia una señora muy trabajadora. El negocio que ella tiene lo estableció hace 21 años en un mercado local caracterizado en  vender productos de artesanía típicos del país. Siendo la atracción de muchos turistas. Tiene un puesto de venta de variedad de artesanías típicas tallado en madera con figuras como: mapas, biblias con texto, jarros, cuadros, variedad de adornos, recuerdos etc. Este negocio es rentable con el cual ha salido adelante trabajando siempre con mucha dedicación.
Esta solicitando su segundo préstamo de 25,000 lempiras para la compra de artesanía para surtir y seguir vendiendo variedad en su negocio, y así sus ventas puedan incrementar aun mas, y su negocio este siempre estable.
texts.en:
Alicia, 66, is a single mother living with her children in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.  Alicia is a very hardworking woman.  The business she has started 21 years ago in a local market; she sells crafts that are typical of the country; they are attractive to many tourists.  She has a stand where she sells a variety of typical crafts made of carved wood figures like maps, Bibles with text, jugs, picture frames, an assortment of decorations, keepsakes, etc.  This is a profitable business she’s gotten ahead with by always working with much dedication.

She’s asking for her second loan in the amount of 25,000 lempiras to buy crafts to stock up with and continue selling a good variety in her business so that her sales will increase again and her business will always be stable.

loans.use: to buy crafts to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines (syrups, injections and tablets)

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
José es un joven muy emprendedor, el tiene como actividad un negocio de venta de comida y servicio de transporte. El inicio este negocio hace 5 años, tiene ya sus propios clientes de empresas. La madre de José le ayuda en la elaboración de los alimentos y el se dedica a distribuirla. También tiene un taxi donde presta el servicio de taxi colectivo. Manifiesta que en los dos negocios le va muy bien y hasta el momento esta satisfecho con el servicio que ofrece a sus clientes.
Actualmente esta solicitando su primer préstamo de 24,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de un refrigerador para mantener en buen estado los productos y también comprara insumos necesarios para elaborar los alimentos.
Su meta en el futuro es poner su puesto de comida en un lugar céntrico donde sus negocio crezca mas y tener mejor solvencia económica para cuando forme una familia,  también sus sueño es comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
José is 26-years-old, single and lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

José is a young entrepreneur whose business activity is selling food and providing transportation services.  He started the business five years ago and he already has firms that are his customers.  José’s mother helps him prepare the food and he distributes it.  He also has a taxi that provides collective taxi service.  He states that he does very well in both businesses and to date he’s satisfied with the service he offers his customers.

He is currently asking for his first loan in the amount of 24000 lempiras to buy a refrigerator to store his products properly and also to buy ingredients needed to prepare the food.

His future goal is to set up his food stand in a centrally-located place where his business can grow more to have better economic solvency for when he forms a family.  He also dreams with buying another taxi.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and ingredients needed to prepare food.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old and is married. She takes good care of her two school-aged children.
 
Warlita owns a two-wheeled motorcycle to transport passengers. The motorcycle has the capacity to carry 2 - 4 people to certain destinations. 

Over 23 years, Warlita's good management has made her stand out. At the end of the month, she gets PHP 6,000 which she uses for day-to-day expenditures and on other wants as well. This year, 2012, Warlita applied to GDMPC to have use of financial services. She has applied for PHP 10,000 to purchase motorcycle accessories to improve the service's appearance. Keeping the motorcycle in good running condition brings in good income for the family. This the sixth loan cycle taken by Warlita. Warlita is a very good member of the cooperative.

Warlita hopes to get adequate income from this investment so she can buy a side car to expand the seating capacity of the motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle accessories to improve the vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el Municipio de las Vegas, Santa Barbará.
Juana tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como harina, manteca, arroz, azúcar, huevos, refrescos, productos de abarrotes y verdura. Este negocio lo inicio con la idea de generar sus propios ingresos. Manifiesta que se siente satisfecha teniendo su propio negocio con el cual ha podido ayudar mucho a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Este seria su segundo préstamo que solicita a Odef por 25000 lempiras que le servirá para comprar mas productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos  y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes ya que son productos que se usan diariamente en el hogar.
Agradeciendo a Odef por la oportunidad en brindar el capital de trabajo para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, 48, is married and has a son; she lives in the town of Las Vegas in Santa Bárbara.  Juana has a business which is a small grocery store where she sells basic staple items like flour, lard, rice, sugar, eggs, soft-drinks, groceries and vegetables.  She started this business aiming at generating income of her own.  She states that she feels satisfied having her own business that has made it possible for her to help her husband cover household expenses.

This would be her second loan request to ODEF for 25,000 lempiras that will serve to buy staple items like basic grains thus meeting customer demand since they are products that are used daily in homes.

She is grateful to ODEF for providing the working capital to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items for her store.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de siete años y el otro de un año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, trabaja durante la mañana en el mercado realizando las ventas todos los días de lunes a sábado, este negocio lo aprendió a través de su madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de frutas y verduras frescas que le permita ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y productos de los más demandados, por ejemplo tomates, papas, cebolla, repollo, manzanas, peras, uvas, entre otras que se pueden mencionar son de la elección de los clientes, esta compra le ayudará a incrementar su inventario y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio a través de los préstamos, ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida por medio de su ingreso.
texts.en:
Gloria is 33 years old.  She lives with her husband and her two children who are 7 years and 1 year old.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables.  Gloria works in the market and makes her sales every morning from Monday to Saturday.  She learned this business from her mother.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.  This will enable her to offer her customers a better variety and more of the most popular produce.  She will buy tomatoes, potatoes, onion, cabbage, apples, pears, grapes and other produce that her customers request.  This purchase will help her to increase her stock and improve her income.

Gloria's goal is to grow in her business by taking out loans.  She would like to offer her children a better quality of life through the income she makes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onion, cabbage, apples, pears and grapes

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es originaria de Granada, de 36 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, viven independientes, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa, es dueña de un tramo en la ciudad de Granada, su nivel académico es hasta la primaria pues su situación económica no le permitió culminar sus estudios. Maria inicio su actividad desde los 19 años de edad ayudándole a su mama ya que ella se dedicaba al mismo negocio, luego se casa decide independizarse y establece su propio tramo el cual compro con apoyo de la mama, luego por una mala experiencia con su primer matrimonio tuvo que vender su tramo, pero eso no detuvo a Maria  pues su deseo de superación la ayudo a seguir adelante con apoyo de instituciones financieras decide invertir nuevamente en el negocio siempre apoyada por su mama, hoy en día Maria cuenta  con año y medio  de tener su venta de ropa fija, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su actual esposo, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Granada, su expectativa es diversificarse en productos para su tramo.
Solicita el crédito para comprar camisa, pantalones, faldas, sandalias, etc, todos los productos mas solicitados por sus clientes, ella estima esta inversión será de ayuda ya que podrá estar preparada para la temporada de agosto en que las ventas  mejorando a la vez sus ganancias, sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando en su negocio ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con lo que ha podido salir adelante, sus metas próximas es remodelar el tramo para mayor atracción de clientes todo con el objetivo de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria is a native of Granada, She is 36 years old, married and the mother of two adult sons who live independently. She is a merchant who sells clothing and is the owner of a space. She finished primary school but her economic situation did not allow her to complete her studies .

She started in business at the age of 19 by helping her mother since she, too, was in the clothes selling business. Then she married and wanted to be independent and set up her own space, which she bought with her mother’s support. Then, due to a bad experience with her first marriage, she had to sell her space, but that did not stop Maria since her wish to succeed helped her to continue forward. With the support of funding institutions she decided to invest once again in a business, always supported by her mother. Currently Maria has owned her new clothes selling business for a year and a half. She has her current husband’s support in this endeavor. She sells her products in the city of Granada. She expects to diversify the products in her space.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, sandals, etc., all products in greatest demand by her customers. She estimates that this investment will be a help because it will enable her to prepare for the August season when her sales improve and her profits, as well. Her future plans are to continue working in her business because it is something she enjoys doing and it has made it possible for her to move ahead. Her next goal is to remodel the space to better attract customers, all with the objective of getting ahead. Carry on, Maria!

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, sandals,etc.

loans.name: Sandra Arely

texts.es:
Sandra, se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y bisutería, este negocio lo heredo de sus padres quienes ya murieron, ella y sus hermanas le dieron seguimiento a los negocios sabiendo llevar hasta el día de hoy por un buen camino lo que han heredado de sus padres, ella vive con sus hermanos que son 4 y 3 sobrinos, ella está soltera, todos se apoyan con el fin de ampliar el negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva como blusas y faldas, ropa interior, también comprará muestrarios para poder exhibir la mercadería, mejorando la visibilidad a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la apariencia y hacer más llamativo el negocio.
El objetivo de Sandra es a futuro poder mejorar la vivienda en la que reside con sus hermanos, espera conseguirlo a través del desarrollo y la rentabilidad que le genere el negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra sells clothes, footwear and costume jewelry.  She inherited this business from her parents who are deceased.  She and her sisters carried on with the business and have succeeded to date in continuing forward along a good path with what they inherited from their parents.  She lives with her four siblings and three nephews.  She’s single.  Everyone supports each other in order to expand the business.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy new clothes like blouses, skirts and underwear; she will also buy display cases to exhibit the merchandise improving visibility for the customers.  This loan will help her improve the appearance of her business making it more eye-catching.

Sandra’s objective is to be able to make some improvements to the house she lives in with her siblings in the future; she hopes to accomplish this through the development and profitability her business generates.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, vive con su abuela, José a realiza la siembra de maíz y frijol desde pequeño con su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso, quien tiene una experiencia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos para la agricultura, comprándose abono, semilla mejorada, pago de mozos, esto le ayudara a mejorar la producción de granos básicos y los prevendrá de las plagas, dándole la oportunidad de crecer.
La aspiración de José es seguir cultivando maiz, agregar otro cultivo, apoyar a su familia para salir adelante, mejorando su trabajo y la producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
José works growing corn.  He lives with his grandmother.  José started planting corn and beans when he was still little with his father who taught him the entire process; he has experience.

He’s asking for a loan to buy farm supplies.  He will buy manure, improved seed and will pay for laborers which will help him improve the production of basic grains keeping them safe from infestations and giving him the opportunity to grow.

José’s hope is to continue growing corn and to add another crop, to support his family so that they can get ahead improving his work and the production of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mohzoda

texts.ru: Мохзода проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Мохзода занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров и семечек. Торговлей она занимается более 18 лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Mohzoda lives in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 43 years old, married and has one child.  Her son is in the Russian Federation for work.  Mohzoda is involved in selling household goods and seeds.  She has been in sales for over 18 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Благодаря кредиту, полученному при помощи поддержки Фонда КИВА, Светлана смогла приумножить количество скота и получить доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Учитывая успешный опыт заимствования и хороший результат -  на сегодня ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 коровы, 3 теленка, 6 лошадей и 25 овец, Светлана повторно обратилась в компанию "Бай - Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Светлана планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan, obtained with the help and support of the Kiva Fund, Svetlana was able to increase livestock quantities and earn income from sales of milk and milk products.  Considering her successful borrowing experience and a good result, today her business contains four cows, three calves, six horses and twenty-five sheep.  Svetlana once again requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hazell

texts.es: La joven Hazell de 25 años de edad, clienta Kiva, es habitante de Granada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa, es dueña de una tienda de ropa en el mercado local de la ciudad, madre de dos hijos que están a su cargo, su primer crédito fue de ayuda porque pudo invertir en su negocio para la temporada escolar, utilizo el préstamo para comprar uniformes escolares y mochilas, hoy en día ella quiere diversificarse aun mas en productos variados, es  por esta razón que realiza su segundo crédito Kiva para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y calzado para su tienda con el objetivo de mantener su negocio surtido con los productos  que están de moda en esta temporada, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hermana quien la ayuda con la administración del negocio,  ella estima esta nueva inversión será de ayuda ya que le permitirá incrementar aun mas sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos y  más comodidad para la familia. Hazell espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su negocio activo y cumplir sus sueños de poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Hazell, 25, is a young Kiva client living in Granada; she’s a clothing merchant.  She owns a clothing store in the local market.  She’s the mother of two children who are in her care.  

Her first loan was of help because she was able to invest it in her business for the school term; she used the loan to buy school uniforms and backpacks.  At present, she wants to diversify still more with varied products which is why she’s taking out her second Kiva loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts and footwear for her store with the objective of keeping the business well-stocked with merchandise that’s in style for the season.

Her sister helps her run the business.  She feels that this new investment will be of help because it will allow her to increase her sales still more generating better income at the same time for her family’s comfort.  Hazell hopes to continue to be able to rely on Kiva support to keep her business active and to reach her dream of being able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Doña Luz habitante de Granada, de 44 años de edad, es casada, su nivel académico es hasta quinto año de secundaria, de oficio comerciante se dedica a elaboración de pan y repostería, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo, actualmente estudian. Ella inicio su actividad hace dos con apoyo de su esposo quien tiene una fábrica de esencias y la motivo a poner su negocio en su casa de habitación para generar más ingresos para la familia. Luz comercializa sus productos en su comunidad y en los alrededores de Granada, su esposo aporta para los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos. Realizo el crédito para comprar azúcar, harina, manteca y levadura para invertir en su negocio, ella dice que le gustaría diversificar sus productos en otras zona para mayor atracción de clientes, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio activo para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, lives in Granada; she’s married and her academic level is 5th grade of elementary school.  She’s a merchant by profession dedicated to making bread and pastries.  She’s the mother of four children who are in her care and currently attending school.  She started her activity two years ago with support from her husband who has a spice factory.  The reason for setting up a home-based business was to generate more family income.

Luz sells her products in her community and in Granada’s surroundings.  Her husband contributes to family expenses with other income.  She took out the loan to buy sugar, flour, shortening and yeast to invest in her business.  She says that she’d like to diversify her products in other zones to attract more customers.  Her plan for the future is to keep the business active to meet customer demand in order to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, shortening and yeast.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque inicia el proceso de la cultura, sembrando nuevamente el maíz para lo cual necesita abono, herbicidas, foliares, que piensa adquirirlos con los fondos de este préstamo, ayudándole a tender lo necesario para proteger al cultivo de las plagas.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior le permitio alquilar el terreno y  mejorar la productividad de granos básicos obteniendo una buena producción la cual logró vender la cosecha y generarle un buen nivel de ingresos a su familia, todo esto a través del préstamo y de kiva que le facilitan su trabajo.
texts.en:
José’s asking for a new loan because he’s starting a new corn planting cycle and needs manure, herbicide and leaf fertilizer that he plans to get with funds from this loan helping him to have everything he’ll need to protect his crop from infestations.

His previous loan’s effect was that he was able to lease farmland and to improve basic grain productivity obtaining a good production.  He sold his harvest and generated good income levels for his family.  All of this was thanks to the loan and to Kiva which make his work easier.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is an enterprising 37-year-old businesswoman, married to a businessman. They are blessed with six children. She has been running a greengrocer's shop in an open-air market for the past seven years. She earns a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan to Yehu microfinance after being introduced by a Yehu staff member. Mwanasha will use the loan to buy fresh vegetables and fruit. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business to add more variety to her stock of fruit and vegetables. She hopes to buy a plot and build a rental house. With this in mind, her major limitation is lack of capital to fund her business. Mwanasha lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Margarita De La Concepcion

texts.es: La joven Margarita es originaria de Granada, de 22 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad por iniciativa propia ya que quería ser alguien independiente, anteriormente era asalariada pues trabajaba en una empresa privada, de la liquidación que recibió del trabajo decide poner su propio negocio en su casa de habitación, donde recibe el apoyo de su mama que le ayuda con las compras diarias para el negocio, su esposo es asalariado la apoya con los gastos del hogar como otros ingresos. Margarita se siente satisfecha con su negocio pues cuenta con clientes fijos además es un negocio rentable, genera ingresos diarios. Realiza el crédito para comprar gaseosa, leche, queso, arroz, pan, jabón, etc. Todos los productos necesarios para surtir su pulpería, el cual estima  será de ayuda ya que le permitirá incrementar su mercadería con productos mas solicitados por sus clientes.  Sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y diversificarse en productos variados para mantener su pulpería activa y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Margarita is a 22-year-old native of Granada, Nicaragua. She is married and makes a living running a convenience store that she started on her own because she wanted to be independent. Previously she was employed at a private company, and from the severance she received she decided to start her own business in her home, where her mother helps her with the business' daily purchases. Her husband is employed and supports the household finances. Margarita feels satisfied with her business because she has regular customers and it is profitable, generating daily income. She plans to use the loan to purchase soft drinks, milk, cheese, rice, bread, soap and other items, all of which are necessary products to stock her store. She hopes it will be a help and allow her to increase her inventory with the products in highest demand from her customers. Her plans for the future are to expand the size of her business and to diversify her products to keep her store active and make headway for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, milk, cheese, rice, bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar materia prima para elaborar loza, adquiriendo los materiales como la tierra, nacazcol, leña, y pagando mano de obra, con esto deberá seguir produciendo las ollas, comales y sartenes para comercializarla en el mercado.
Con el préstamo anterior manifiesta haber sido una gran ayuda para poder comprar varios materiales para la producción, ha logrado tener un buen nivel de ventas y de su ganancias, se ha comprado varios electrodomésticos para el hogar, hasta el momento el número de miembros de su familia se aumentó en un hijo más.
texts.en:
Norma has decided on a new loan because she needs to buy raw materials to make cookware; she will buy supplies like clay, nacazcol [a dye], and firewood and will pay labor costs.  With this she will continue to make pots, griddles and pans to sell in the market.

She states that the previous loan was of great help to her to buy several materials for production.  She’s managed to have a good level of sales and profits.  She’s purchased several home appliances and to date her family has increased by one morel members; she had another child.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol [dye], firewood and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is happily single in status. He is 28 years of age. 

Albert is in the food business sector selling barbecue/grilled pork, chicken, and hot dogs in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over a year. From this business he has a monthly income in the amount of Php 2,500. 

Recently, he joined GDMPC to access financial services. He needs additional investment for the business venture in which he is engaged. He requested a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 to purchase pork meat for the grilled/barbecue ingredients.

He hopes that with the income he is earning from his business he can expand his business to increase the amount of income he receives.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat for grilled/barbecue ingredients.

loans.name: Genmar

texts.en:
Genmar is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is 28 years old and married. He has two school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper.

In his married life, Genmar has allowed himself to discover his ability to run a business, particularly in retail, making it a central source of income for the family. Every month, he makes a return of about PHP 3,210. 

Earlier this year, he joined GDMPC. He has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to buy supplementary products like sugar, salt, sardines, vinegar, and others to sell in the local community. Genmar hopes for prosperous years of business. He plans to sustain and build his business and increase his sales to make a good cash inflow.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products to sell, like sugar, salt, sardines, vinegar, and others.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is married to a driver and is blessed with three school-going children. She runs a grocery store where she works very hard to ensure that she fulfills the needs of the family as well as the needs of her clientele. Her dream remains to expand the business and hire employees. Despite the challenge of seasonality, especially with the scarcity of some vegetables during the dry season, Mgeni works hard to ensure that her dream comes true. She has been in this business for the past five years. She also sells foodstuffs in the open air as a side business.

Mgeni lives in a rental house that has electricity but no running water. She is requesting a loan to Yehu through Kiva. This will be her first loan, and she anticipates expanding the business with the profit she makes. The loan will be used to buy onions, tomatoes, and fruit.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and fruit.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally is married and has four children. She is 40 years old. She lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Ma. Sally used her last loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets, and her business has grown and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan to repair her fishing boat. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, se decidio por un nuevo préstamo con la intención de fortalecer el negocio, invirtiendolo en la compra de materiales agrícolas como abonos e insecticidas para la siembra, en media manzana de terreno también realizará la siembra de café, el credito le ayudará brindándole lo necesario para poder seguir trabajando en agricultura.
El efecto que tuvo con préstamo anterior fue la gran ayuda para la siembra de hortalizas, obtuvo una cosecha abundante y sana, sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia están cambiando debido a sus ingresos por la venta de cosecha.
texts.en: José decided to request a new loan with the goal of strengthening his business by investing in the purchase of planting materials like fertilizers and insecticides. He will also plant coffee on half a plot of land. The loan will provide him with the necessary items to continue working in agriculture. The previous loan had a big impact in helping him to grow vegetables. He had an abundant and healthy harvest, and the living conditions for he and his family are changing thanks to the income he has made from selling his harvested products.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 70-year-old married man. He looks after three dependants who are his grandchildren. Martin has taken out thirteen loans from UGAFODE Microfinance and this is the fourteenth. This sequence of consistent loans has helped change his status from a tenant to a landlord. He now owns rental units in the city outskirts, and these have become his major source of income since he can no longer do any kind of manual work because of his advanced age. Through this rental income he was able to pay school fees for his children.
He wants UGX 1,000,000 to renovate one of the rental rooms. His main challenge is tenants moving during the night before paying their rent arrears, or not maintaining the houses in good condition. Martin is a very creative, honest, and hard-working old man.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married and works hard to support her family of four. They live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past six years, Lina has operated a business selling dried fish in Tiribe, Kenya. Previously, she was a very hard-working farmer selling her farm products to her neighbors, which enabled her to get starting capital for her business. However, this capital is not enough to expand the business, so
she is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 through Yehu to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and open a kiosk, and also make sure that her children are educated. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, since these fish become scarce in certain seasons, which greatly affects her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mbui

texts.en:
Mbui is 30 years old and lives in Mteza, a small village at the south coast of Kenya. He is married and has three children who are not yet enrolled in school. 

As his family's main source of income, Mbui operates a motorcycle, a business he has been doing after terminating an employment with a small company. Thanks to his hard work, today his business has stabilized with many clients. This brings him a monthly profit of Ksh 12,000.

With the goal of further developing his business and purchasing another motorcycle, Mbui applied to Yehu Microfinance through Kiva for a loan of Ksh 30,000 for the purchase of petrol and also to service the motorcycle. 

Mbui is planning to invest the income from his loan in further developing his business. Although he remains focused on his goal, he also experiences a challenge of seasonality, whereby his business does poorly during the wet season based on the fact that he operates his motorcycle on a rough, muddy road that is worsened when it rains.

loans.use: to purchase petrol and also service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is single. She is a very hardworking, beautiful entrepreneur who does not fear any risks. She lives in her own house that has no electricity but does have piped water, and she is determined to have power installed in the near future. Fatuma has a business selling fried potatoes and fish in a small stall that is located opposite her house. She has been in this business for the past year and she has a great passion for her business, her main goal being opening a shop in the future and hiring employees. 

Fatuma lives in Tiribe, a small village in the coastal region of Kenya, and she relates well with her clients, something that enables her to increase her monthly profits. She says that over the past year, her monthly income has increased to KSH 4,000, though she started with very little capital given to her by her mother. Fatuma also narrates that the majority of her clients are students, especially for the fried potato business. The loan she has applied for from Yehu through Kiva will help her to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and fish for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and fish.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Jocelyn used her last loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan for her transport service business, to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories.

loans.name: Komboza

texts.en:
Komboza, 30, is a resident of Tiribe, Kenya. He is a very enterprising man and works extra hard to ensure that he caters to the basic needs of his wife and three children. 

After saving money from his business selling water, Komboza decided to open a second business selling fish to supplement his income. This business is now one year old. Komboza is very grateful to his wife, who is also a very committed businesswoman, for her support. Both partners contribute to the welfare of the entire family. 

Komboza's greatest challenge is poor transport infrastructure, since his home is located away from the highway. This also increases the cost of transport. Komboza lives in a small semi-permanent house with neither electricity nor piped water, but he is hoping to have both facilities in future. 
He continues to dream of owning a wholesale business in the future, and he believes that his children will proceed well with their studies now that they are in primary school. 

His loan of KSH 30000 will be used to purchase stock of fish.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fish.

loans.name: Mato

texts.en:
Mato is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 44 years of age, married, and blessed with five children. His wife takes care of their children. Two children are now in High School and the others are in elementary.

Mato is engaged in the retail business, selling his own caught crabs and fish to earn a living. He has has his own small fish pond. He has been in this business for about four years. With this business venture, he earns 3,800 PHP each month.

Mato has discussed his needs with one of our account officers assigned to his location. Upon hearing about the cooperative and the terms and conditions, Mato applied for a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase crab fingerlings to raise. Mato hopes that in the near future his fish pond will expand and increase the amount of harvest he can sell for a greater return of income.

loans.use: to purchase crab fingerlings to raise.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old. She is married and has four children.
Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.
Elsie has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she also earns an income from fishing.
Elsie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Mary Ann has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. Aside from that, she also sells fruit and vegetables. She has had this business for five years. Mary Ann requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks, detergents, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Mamerta earns additional income from coffee bean retail and raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. Mamerta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Janec

texts.en: Eighteen-year-old Janec lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She does not attend school now because of financial difficulties in her family. She is working at her family's rice farm to help earn money to cover their basic needs and to save for her college education. She has also applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. Janec hopes to have sufficient income to pay for school fees and reinvest in their farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña  Aty es el comité integrado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, que se encuentra en su primer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en la capacitaciones.
Petrona es una mujer muy trabajadora y día a día lo demuestra por medio de su sacrificado trabajo. Ella se dedica al reciclado de todo tipo de productos, como ser de cartones, plásticos, aluminio y demás  tipos de productos reciclados, los cuales recoge cuando recorre por las calles.
Petrona solicita el crédito para la compra de cartones, aluminio y plásticos en cantidad, los cuales ella revenderá y de esa forma tendrá mayores ganancias y podrá seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Kuna Aty is a group made up of 15 women in the city of Asuncion which is in its first cycle. Each of the member has a strong sense of responsibility and desire for progress regarding the loan assistance. 

Petrona is a very hard-working woman and day by day she shows it by way of her hard toil. She earns her living recycling different sorts of products, such as cardboard, plastic, aluminium and other types of recyclable products, which she collects when she wanders the streets. 

Petra is asking for a loan to buy cardboard, aluminium and plastic in bulk, which she will resell and in this way increase her income so that she can continue growing as a microbusiness.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, aluminium and plastic etc for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo, que siempre saben salir adelante, el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y comentan que por medio de su trabajo en conjunto desean ayudarse y mejorar el estilo de sus familias.
 La Sra. María es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto , ella hace venta de cosméticos Avon por pedidos  y a traves del  tiempo ya tiene una buena clientela. María desea tener su propio negocio y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
María solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is a very active group, with people who always know how to get ahead. The group is in their third loan cycle in the program for entrepreneurial women, and they comment that through their work together, they want to help each other and improve the standard of living for their families.

María is the group's treasurer, and she always knows how to carry out the duties of her position well. She sells Avon cosmetics in response to orders, and over time she has built up a good customer base. María wants to have her own business and thus keep helping her family. 

María is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics, which will allow her to keep working and thus she can keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children.  Josephine is a clothes dealer, with a business she began five years ago. In this business, she sells bed sheets, towels, and trousers. Josephine was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she joined in order to access funding for her business.

Josephine is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase a new stock of clothes. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to educate her children. Her ambition is to open another clothes stall in the future. The challenges facing her business are the seasonal business climate and high transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of clothes.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité “San Cayetano” es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, este es un numeroso grupo que se ha unido con el propósito de poder recibir un apoyo para poder seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
Eulalia es una de las miembros del grupo, es muy trabajadora y tiene un gran espíritu de superación y quiere sobresalir para ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de todo tipo, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y ayuda en los gastos del día a día. Su meta es poder tener una zapatería para poder tener mayores ingresos y mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y también estar cada día más cerca de cumplir su meta.
texts.en: The “San Cayetano” Group is from the city of Villa Elisa. It is a large group that has come together with the goal of receiving support to keep working and making headway. Eulalia is one of the members of the group. She is a very hard worker with a strong desire to move up in life and rise above in order to help her family. She makes a living selling all kinds of footwear, with which she helps her family with day to day expenses. Her goal is to have a shoe store to be able to increase her income and offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase footwear to expand her offerings and become closer each day to reaching her goal.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Philippines. Mercideta owns farm land and cultivates rice for a living and she has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 25,000 doing this type of business. 

Mercideta requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Mercideta wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
Rosita requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business.
Rosita has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for seven years and would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old and married. She has four children, and two of her children are in school.
Cristina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Cristina has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Abel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells cosmetics at a kiosk. 

To help expand his business, Abel has requested a loan of 3 million Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the business, and will help Abel to generate greater profits and add more stock. Abel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Abel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more items for his business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rowena sells different kinds of fish in their local community. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a variety of fish to sell, like sardines, milk fish, and flying fish.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle and also ready-to-wear (RTW) items to sell through her clothing business.

NWTF is relisting Belly 's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle and ready-to-wear (RTW) items to sell.

loans.name: Patrocena

texts.en:
Patrocena is 74 years old, married and has six children. She is a hard working entrepreneur. 

Patrocena has a sari sari store in the Philippines, and is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, married, is 28 years old, residing at Pandahan, SND, Philippines. Maricel operates a fishing venture, selling fish while her husband does the fishing. She has been in this business for two years. Each month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Maricel joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Leila works hard to support her family. She has a business selling plastic-ware in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food.  Leila is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more items like plastic-ware, toys, school supplies, etc.

Leila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like plastic-ware, toys, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Corazon earns additional income from selling natural medicines.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en:
Mylyn is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 22 years old, married, and has one infant. Mylyn owns and operates a dried fish selling business. She has been in this business for four years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2011, Mylyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to buy more dried fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling round lumber in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Teresita earns additional income from a boarding house and gasoline retailing.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of lumber to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. Teresita dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of lumber to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is from the city of Mombasa. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are attending school. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at the municipal market in Tiribe trading center.

Thanks to the high quality of the products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to buy fruits such as coconuts, mangoes, and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu microfinanace and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her. She is working hard to make sure that she opens another business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as coconuts, mangoes, and other types of products

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Mary Ann has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Mary Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beverages, canned goods, detergents, and snacks.

loans.name: Adeliada

texts.en:
Adeliada is 43 years old. She is married and has five children.  They live in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Adeliada used her last loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan to repair her fishing boat. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more in the future.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, aged 31, is married and has two children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Emily has owned and operated a retail store, selling a variety of products to earn a living, for the past seven years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from her business. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell. In 2009, Emily joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to support the completion of her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Aged 32 years old, Sitha is a mother of one dependent son and lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. She is a farmer and a tailor. She has been involved in these businesses for 10 years and can earn up to US $5 per day. 

Sitha took her first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has successfully repaid the entire loan already. The past loan helped her to improve her living conditions, especially in having a proper shelter. She is now applying for new loan with VisionFund to buy a cow for the purposes of plowing her farmland and crossbreeding. She hopes to receive a better crop yield and have a lot of calves for her farm as well as for sale.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her farmland and crossbreeding

loans.name: Loyola

texts.en:
Loyola is 63 years old, married and has seven children, one of whom is in school. For the past 25 years she has raised and sold pigs.

Loyola has taken out five loans in the past through NWTF. She is now requesting a 18,000 PHP loan to buy feed and medicine for her pigs. In the future, Loyola would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosibell

texts.en:
Rosibell works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.
Rosibell requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
She has been in this business for five years.
In the future, Rosibell would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 30 years old. He lives in a small village of Mtskheta District with his mother, Zoia. They run an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow various beautiful flowers which they sell on the local open market. Zoia is busy with trading as well; she buys hens in the village and sells them in the nearest towns. Nikoloz also works construction and gets a service fee of approximately 200 Lari per month. Their total average monthly income is 700 Lari.

Nikoloz has requested a loan for purchasing a car. He plans to buy the car with gas installation to use for selling their flowers. With the car, he will be able to move comfortably and easily. This will save the costs related to renting a car. Thus, he will decrease his transportation costs and increase his income accordingly. He will spend the biggest portion of his income to develop the agricultural business. As a result, he will be able to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and has five children. She runs a small kiosk and is a very hard-working and tenacious woman always making efforts to get ahead in life. Riziki told us she started working in this field more than 10 years ago because there was a need for a kiosk in her neighborhood. Little by little, she has been able to grow, thanks to her job.

She is requesting a loan to buy general products such as rice, flour, sugar and oil, and baked products. Thanks to this investment she will keep on selling high quality products, consequently increasing her sales and her income. 

Riziki was introduced to Yehu by her friend and is happy with their services. Her major dream is to send all her children to college in future.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, oil and baked products.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorna has been in this business for 13 years now, and earns additional income from hog raising and tailoring.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine and fishing net for her fishing business. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 40 years old and has six children, all of whom are in school. She has various sewing machines that she uses for her sewing and dressmaking jobs, which provide a large part of her household income. This complements the income earned by her husband, who works for Kenya Ports Authority in the city of Mombasa, Kenya.
Riziki has been in this business for five years. She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. Her goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, and lace. Riziki is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and to accomplish quickly the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.
She lives in her own house that has electricity but no running water.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, and lace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ukay-ukay (second-hand) cloth (e.g. used bed sheets and curtains) to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
