Fatuma is married to a farmer and operates a business selling fruit. She is working very hard to make sure that she supports her family's needs. Fatuma has six children, all of whom are in school. She states that much of her monthly income, which is approximately 6000 KES, goes to school fees for her children. Her aim is to make sure that all of her children have reached university level.
Fatuma has been in this business for the past one and a half years, after gaining farming experience. She resides in her own house that has neither electricity nor running water – though her desire is to have both electricity and running water in her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.
Fatuma tells us that her business is doing well but that her major challenge is lack of enough capital to achieve her dream of opening a retail shop in the future. This is also a motivation for joining Yehu, after being introduced to it by a friend.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa, aged 53, is married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Luisa has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past five years. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Sandra has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines for the past four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store. Sandra aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 42 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school.
Virgilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.
Virgilia has been farming vegetables for 5 years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Virgilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 47 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Felisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.
Felisa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en: Elgen is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Elgen has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells snacks, shampoo, candies & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Elgen has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Elgen hopes to improve her business in order to be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a food-vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years.

Lerma has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 38 years old and is married with two children.  With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Roberta has run a general store in the Philippines for the past eight years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

Roberta has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works hard to support her family. Ailyn is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.
Ailyn requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.
Ailyn has been in this business for seven years now.
In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail business through which she sells native bags (made from natural products) in the Philippines. Lucia has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more native bags to sell to customers. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy native bags to sell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 25 years old and is married to a businessman, with whom she has not yet had any children. 

For two years, Salama has had an itinerant clothing business where she sells all types of products. In her house, she has a convenience store that her husband operates. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who does not fear work or challenges. Salama describes the high cost of transport as the major challenge hindering the growth of her business.

Salama is applying for this loan to buy khangas (wrap-around garments) and dresses so that she will have a good variety to offer her customers. She comments that in the future she wants to expand her store until it becomes a self-service store.

loans.use: to buy khangas (wrap-around garments) and dresses

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Babylyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Babylyn has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Babylyn hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy snacks, detergents, canned goods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Elvira earns additional income from selling frozen food and Avon products.

Elvira is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional clothing to sell in her ready-to-wear business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Elvira dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 66 years old, is married and has four children. To make a living, Conchita has been running a general store for the past 10 years, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Conchita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product range. In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product range

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has children. Farming is the main source of his family's income. Lucio cultivates his land to grow rice crops to sell. He works hard to increase his income and keep up with the increasing needs in his household. 

Lucio has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to own a larger area of farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past 15 years.

Felisa has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a food-vending business in the Philippines for the past seven years. Analyn earns additional income from a general store

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: C5692 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old and is married with five children. She takes care of four relatives. He sells vegetables. She is the president of the group which is called " C5692 ABADACOGORA" in the local language and she is the one who has a paper in her hand. She currently employs 1 person to help her and she has 10 years of experience in this business

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more vegetables for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, to reinvest in her business, to renovate her house and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Serlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Serlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear clothing and a general store. Serlinda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of materials for her tailoring business.

Serlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send two of her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of materials for her business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Salvacion requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Santa Catalina 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa Catalina  II”  en honor a la santa patrona del Barrio. El grupo gracias a su trabajo se encuentra ya en el quinto ciclo con 26 integrantes donde todas tratan de ayudarse para salir adelante.
Elida, la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, en lo que le va muy bien, pues tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos pues tiene muy buena sazón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los insumo s que necesita para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee calls itself "Santa Catalina II" in honor of the patron saint of Barrio. Thanks to its work the group already finds itself in its fifth loan cycle with 26 members where all of them try to help each other get ahead.

Elida, the president of the group, makes a living selling all types of food. This is going well for her as she has a good clientele who always buys their products from her as her food has good flavor.

She is requesting the loan to purchase meat, vegetables, seasonings, and other supplies to be able to continue making the supplies that she needs to fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Nenita is married and has one child. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a fish selling business. Nenita has been engaged in her business for 41 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Margarita used her last loan to purchase additional fruit to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fruit to sell. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 63 años de edad, e casada y tiene un hijo, vive en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la región Piura. La zona es de calidad de vida bastante precaria y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una bodega instalada en una parte de su domicilio, allí atiende todos los días de la semana a sus vecinos y conocidos, debido a su buen trato es conocida de la zona, además cuenta con mas 8 años en su negocio con lo que conoce bastante su actividad. Ademas se dedica a la crianza de ovinos en corrales ubicados cerca a su domicilio.

Alejandrina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, los que invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega, ademas comprará alimentos para el engorde de sus animales y asi seguir creciendo en su negocio, esta inversion le permitirá también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 63 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in one of the hamlets that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande in the region of Piura. The area's quality of living is very precarious and she only has electric service.

She makes a living selling essential items in a store installed in a part of her home. There, she sees to her neighbors and acquaintances every day of the week. Due to her good treatment she is known in the area. Moreover, she has had her business for more than 8 years for which reason she knows the business very well. She also makes a living raising sheep in farmyard near her home.

Alejandrina finds herself requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will invest in the purchase of essential items she will stock her store with. Moreover she will buy food to fatten her animals with and thus continue growing her business. This investment will also allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy essential items with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Mariechu

texts.en:
Mariechu is 28 years old and married with one child.

Mariechu works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mariechu has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Mariechu aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Luchadoras de la ciudad de Villa Elisa tiene 17 integrantes. Todas se muestran muy unidas y realizan actividades permanentes para el logro de los objetivos grupales, se muestran solidarias y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.
Celsa es miembro del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, y que ya tiene muy buena clientela porque tiene muy buen precio. Cuenta que se esfuerza siempre por ayudar a los suyos y darles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Celsa solicita el crédito para la compra de Carbón, para tener su producto en stock y de esa forma cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe, pues está más cerca de su propósito,  que es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Luchadoras from the city of Villa Elisa has 17 members. They are all very united and carry out permanent activities for the success of the group objectives. They are supportive and have a great desire to progress forward.

Celsa is a member of the group and says she makes a living selling coal. She already has a good clientele because she offers a very good price. She says that she always makes an effort to help her own and give them what they need for a life that's not lacking in anything.

Celsa is questing the loan to buy coal and have her product in stock. In this way she can fulfill her customers' demands She is grateful for the opportunity that she's received as she is much closer to her purpose which is to have a big storeroom.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Santos Rosario

texts.es:
Santos tiene 57 años de edad, es viudo y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la región Piura. La calidad de vida en la zona es bastante precaria, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla es la agricultura, cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde tiene sembrado mango y limón en producción, ambos productos son típicos de la zona y son exportados al exterior a través de asociaciones de pequeños productores, del mismo modo, también abastecen el mercado interno. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. 

Santos se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertirlos en la compra de abonos para la fertilización del cultivo de mango. Santos agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Santos is 57. He is a widower, and has no children in his care. He lives in his own home, located in one of the settlements that make up the rural part of the farming district of Tambogrande, in Piura region. The quality of life in the area is quite precarious, but it has electricity.

His business is farming, and he has a piece of farmland where he has planted mango and lemon that are in production. Both products are typical of the area, and are exported to other countries through associations of small producers. In the same way, they also supply the domestic market. In addition, he raises smaller livestock such as pigs and poultry, and when they attain ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market. 

Santos is requesting a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he intends to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his mango crop. 

Santos thanks in advance, the people who help him achieve his objective through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his mango crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the repair shop and pay for the electricity.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Babylyn has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Babylyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. 

In the future, Babylyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a barquillos-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients. Helen has been in this business for 29 years. She also earns income from ice cream making.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 49 años de edad. Vive con su pareja y un hijo en el distrito de Olmos, en un caserío cerca de la zona urbana del distrito, la zona es agrícola y bastante comercial, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. Conoce a la perfección el rubro. El adquiere animales de sus vecinos y conocidos, los cría en su vivienda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Eduardo solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos  mejor cubrir sus gastos familiares. Anteriormente ha tenido un préstamo financiado por Kiva y le ha ido bastante bien, ahora desea seguir creciendo como empresario y ha recurrido nuevamente a Kiva para salir adelante. El se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le ayudaron en su momento y también agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 49 years old. He lives with his partner and a son in Olmos district, in a settlement near the urban part of the district. It is a farming area with quite a bit of commercial agriculture. It is part of Lambayeque province and located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises and sells sheep and goats. He has been in this business for many years, and is extremely knowledgeable in this field. He buys animals from his neighbors and acquaintances and raises them at his home. When they have attained a good size and weight, he sells them in the city of Chiclayo.

Eduardo is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy more animals and balanced feed. With this investment, he will be able to increase his income, in order to better meet his family's expenses. 

He has previously had a loan financed by Kiva and it went quite well. Now he wishes to continue his growth as a businessperson and has again drawn upon Kiva funding so that he can move forward. 

He is quite grateful to the people who helped him at that time, and also thanks in advance the people who will help him on this occasion.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from Zemo Alvani village in East Georgia. He is 30 years old, unmarried and lives with his father (a pensioner) and 28-year-old sister. Badri’s mother lives and works abroad to assist the family financially. Badri and his sister are unemployed. Badri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a small scale business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the pension of Badri’s father and financial assistance from his mother. The total average monthly income of the family doesn’t exceed 300 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, Badri’s family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Badri requested a loan from Credo to start up a joiner’s workshop. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to countryside rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Badri has worked as a joiner in the past. He used to make wooden furniture – mainly chairs and tables. With the received credit he will purchase wooden materials and a joiner’s plane. Badri is sure that his start-up business will be successful, as his district recently became quite popular among tourists. Thus, small hostels are being constructed. Badri will supply them with quality furniture for a convenient price. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will increase the income of the family by 100%. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a joiner's plane and wooden materials.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling clothing in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 51 years old and married with 3 children.

Crispina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more  stock to sell.

Crispina has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and farming rice.

Crispina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Aleksander

texts.en:
Aleksander is 52 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in Mtskheta District with his family: his wife Lia and two children (13 and 18 years old). The family runs a small dairy farm with two milk cows. They produce cheese; part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold on the local open market. They grow piglets as well and sell them with a price mark-up in winter in nearby villages. Aleksander’s main activity is football. He is a trainer and has a football team and gets a salary. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Aleksander requested a loan to build a cattle shed. He has his piglets and cows in his aunt’s cattle shed at this moment. In his own shed he will be able to keep more piglets. This will increase the sales from his business. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business in order to increase it and make it more profitable, meaning that the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Crispina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Crispina is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 42 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Resty has been working hard to manage her grocery where she sells fruits and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Resty to generate greater profits and raise her income through an increase of inventory which will lead to an improved standard of living. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large retail business. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Resty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 49 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 12500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Eva has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена портниха. Сам Илхомчон сварщик. Он занимается изготовлением металлических дверей и ворот. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых инструментов и сырья. Кроме того на полученный кредит он намерен отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 31 years of age. He is married and has one child. His wife is a seamstress. Ilhomjon is a welder. He works with manufacturing metallic doors and gates. He has been engaged in this type of activity for seven years.

Ilhomjon takes a loan for the purchase of necessary tools and raw materials. In addition he intends to repair his house for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools, raw materials and to repair his house

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель города Истаравшан. Ему 22 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей. Он в основном занимается торговлей бытовой техники и мебели. В этой области Алишер два года. Он берет кредит для завоза бытовой техники.
texts.en:
Alisher is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. He is 22 years old, and married. He has three children. His wife is a housewife. Alisher works with trade. He is mainly engaged in the trade of household appliances and furniture. Alisher has been in this area for two years.

Alisher takes a loan for the import of household appliances.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Гульнаре 45 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. Гульнара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, также 2,40 га земли , где она выращивает многолетние  травы и картофель.  Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 2,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность оплаты за обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 45 years old, married, and the mother of six children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulnara works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnara's persistent work, her farm today has two cows and further 2.40 hectares of land, where she grows perennial herbs and potatoes. The sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 2,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of sheep and goats. Gulnara plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, in order to have an opportunity to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kulsaada

texts.ru:
Кулсааде 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Кулсаада работает техничкой в местной военной части и  в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1987 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки теленка. Благодаря упорному труду Кулсаады в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, также 1,60 га земли , где она выращивает многолетние  травы и картофель.  Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсаада обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Кулсаада планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность оплаты за обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kulsaada is 50 years old, married, and  the mother of three children. Kulsaada works with maintenance at the local military base. As an additional source of income for her family, she has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1987, after having started this business with the purchase of a calf. Thanks to Kulsaada's persistent work, her farm currently has two cows and further 1.60 hectares of land, where she grows perennial herbs and potatoes. The sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 8,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulsaada turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of sheep and goats. Kulsaada plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, in order to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гульмире 51 год. Гульмира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1980 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  5 овец, 2 коровы, также 3,12 га земли , где она выращивает многолетние  травы и картофель.  Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 17,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства, а в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 51 years old. As a main source of income for her family, Gulmira has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1980, after having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulmira's persistent work, her farm currently has 5 sheep, 2 cows and further 3.12 hectares of land, where she grows perennial herbs and potatoes. The sale of milk and dairy products brings in around 17,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulmira turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of cattle. Gulmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, and she dreams of buying a car for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан  – лидер группы «Акташ», ей  53 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В 1981 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи Алмакан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Алмакан сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством в 1,50 га орошаемой земли,где она выращивает фасоль и картофель и 1 дойной коровой. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и мечтает о покупке машины.
texts.en:
Almakan is the leader for the "Aktash" group. She is 53 years old, married and has raised four children. In 1981, in search of a source of income for her family, Almakan started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation with a starting sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and persistent work, Almakan was able to develop her business to a farm of one cow and 1.50 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans and potatoes. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Almakan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Almakan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business, and she dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария  –участник группы «Акташ», ей  27 лет, замужем. В 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Мария начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Мария сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 3 коров с приплодом, ежемесячный доход составляет  около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мария обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mariya is a member of the "Aktash" group. She is 27 years old and married. In 2008, in search of a source of income for her family, Mariya started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and persistent work, Mariya was able to develop her business to a farm that numbers three cows with offspring, and the monthly income is around 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Mariya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Mariya plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Siynakan

texts.ru: Сыйнакан  –участник группы «Акташ», ей  50 лет, имеет 2 детей. В 1990 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Сыйнакан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Сыйнакан сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота и  ежемесячным доходом около 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сыйнакан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Сыйнакан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Siynakan is a member of the "Aktash" group. She is 50 years old and has two children. In 1990, in search of a source of income for her family, Siynakan started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and persistent work, Siynakan was able to develop her business to a farm that numbers two cows, two calves and 10 heads of sheep and goats, and the monthly income is around 6,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Siynakan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Siynakan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 49 лет, имеет 4 детей. В 1992 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Эльмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 11,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Эльмира сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 1 корову с приплодом, 4 головы мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет сумму около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old and has four children. In 1992, in search of a source of income for her family, Elmira started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation with a starting sum of 11,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and persistent work, Elmira was able to develop her business to a farm numbering one cow with offspring, four sheep and goats, and a monthly income around 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Elmira turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of sheep and goats. Elmira plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул  63 года, вдова, имеет 6 детей. В 1997 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Жумагул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Жумагул сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 2 коровы с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 4,34 га поливной земли с фасолью и картофелем,  ежемесячный доход составляет сумму около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумагул обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота и удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая.
texts.en:
Jumagul is 63 years old, a widow, and has six children. In 1997, in search of a source of income for her family, Jumagul started her business of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation with a starting sum of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to perseverance and persistent work, Jumagul was able to develop her business to a farm numbering two cows with offspring, 10 heads of sheep and goats and 4.34 hectares of irrigated land with beans and potatoes. The monthly income is around 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Jumagul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of sheep and goats and fertilizer. Jumagul plans to invest the income from the loan in the reconstruction of the barn.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is from the village of Tiribe, situated near the south coast of Kenya.. She’s married and has five children who attend school. 

She has been operating a retail shop for many years.  Her husband is a businessman.  She also opened a bakery at home where she supplies bread to retail shops, school canteens and villagers.  Annah says she’d like her children to finish their schooling so that she can expand the business.

Annah’s asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and other supplies to have ensure that her bakery is well-stocked and able to offer a wide variety of goods to her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because she will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and other supplies to have ensure that her bakery is well-stocked.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur.  She is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. 

Rebecca used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell.  Her business has grown up and become successful. 

She's taking a new loan to purchase new items to further expand her product offerings.  Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 58 years old, married and has one child. 

To make a living, Benedicta sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community.  Benedicta has been in her business for 7 years and earns 4,000 a month for these activities. 

Benedicta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.  

In 2010, Benedicta joined GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anavel

texts.en:
Anavel  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Anavel  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 5  years. 

She requests a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Anavel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Anavel hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: C5044 Twitezimberedukora Group

texts.en:
Jean Bosco (center of photo) is 36 years old and is married with 4 children; and he takes care of five relatives.  He is a leader of the group called " C5044 TWITEZIMBEREDUKORA." 

He sells various goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil, salt etc. The daily hours of his business are from 6 a.m to 9 p.m and he currently employs one person to help him. Jean Bosco has one year of experience in this work. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil, salt etc for resale. With any profits, he will save money for his future, to renovate his house, reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil, salt etc for resale.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is a 47 year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer. 

Macaria supports her family by making and selling pillow cases.  Her monthly income is 3000 PHP.  She also helps her husband sell his harvest at their town's market. 

Macaria works hard to help sustain her children's education.  She has requested a loan to purchase threads, cloths, zippers and other materials. Macaria hopes for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase threads, cloths, zippers and other materials.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 31  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Rosalie  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.  She has been in business for 5 years. 

She requests a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 39 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala South region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children who go to school. 

For the past 5 years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells general goods. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Frank generate greater profits, raise his income and improve his standard of living. Frank hopes also hopes to open a wholesale business. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia ismarried and has five children.  She is 53 years old and lives in Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

Lilia operates a transportation business, using a pedicab to earn a living.  She's been in business for 5 years.  Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

She requests a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.  Lilia been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  In the future, Lilia wants to make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 7 children. 

Susan  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari (convenience) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 5 years. 

She requests a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business to cover the cost to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is 35 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Anatoli has been working hard to manage his butchery, which has branches in three places where he supplies meat. 

To help expand his business, Anatoli has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Anatoli generate greater profits so he can improve his family's welfare. Anatoli hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wider market for his items. 

Anatoli is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anatoli who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have outgrown micro-loans.

loans.use: to expand the business.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
Gani is from Kosovo. He is married and he has two children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy beverages, ice cream, food and other items for his shop.  These purchases will help him meet the needs of his customers. 

Gani hopes that the loan will help him increase the size of his shop and thus improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, ice cream, food and other items for his shop.

loans.name: Maydeline

texts.en: Maydeline is married and a mother of one child. She is 32 years old and lives in San Carlos, Tukuran. Maydeline owns and operates a private jeepney transport business. She established the transport business as a way of generating extra income of 4,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for six years. Maydeline requested a loan of 6,240 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase spare parts and accessories. Maydeline has been a good member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Maydeline wants to purchase more jeepneys to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is a 51-year-old mother of five children who resides in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province.  She and her husband are rice farmers and have been in business for 33 years. 

She leads a group of three.  This is her first loan with KIVA's partner, VisionFund.  

Nary and her group members are requesting loans in amount of 600,000 KHR, 1,000,000 KHR, and 800,000 KHR, respectively.  

As the group leader, Nary will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.  She hopes to grow rice healthfully and increase her crop's yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lianie

texts.en:
Lianie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Lianie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had been in business for 7 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Lianie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Lianie hopes to improve her business to help cover the cost of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: C13517 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 34 years old and single, and he takes care of seven relatives.  

Jean Pierre is a leader of the group which called " C13517 ABADAHEMUKA."  He sells a variety of goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil etc.  The hours of his business are from 7 a.m to 6 p.m every day per week.  Jean Pierre has four years of experience in this work and he currently employs three people. 

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil etc for resale.  With any profits, he will save money for his future and pay school fees for his relatives.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil etc for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Mercy is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Mercy has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Mercy hopes to improve her services and earn more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of four children.  Osman lives in Kosovo, in Ashkali community. 

He has had a business selling construction materials from ten years. 

Osman runs the business to provide his family with good living conditions.  And he wants to provide to his children with a good education. Osman requests a loan to buy construction materials in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamet lives in the Ashkali community of Kosovo. He is married and has six children who go to school. 

He has been a KosInvest client for five years and used KosInvest loans to improve his business and for family purposes.  Now he is requesting a loan to repair his taxi vehicle. 

Muhamet also hopes to increase the number of vehicles in his fleet to provide better transport services to his passengers.

His business is Muhamet's only means to support his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is married with 4 children. He is 54 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Eliseo operats a general store, selling a variety of products to local community member to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 7 years and every month he earn 4,000. 

He has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase new items to expand his product offerings.  In 2011, Eliseo joined GDMPC to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Alberta runs a mini store that sells snacks and other items.  She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requests a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of snacks, fresh meat and vegetables.

Alberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks and raw ingredient for making viand

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde, in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past six years, Grace has worked hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general items. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of three million Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to increase her inventory, and will help Grace generate greater profits and improve her business. 

Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the size of her shop and include many goods so it will make more profits. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase the business stock.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 29 years old. He is from the Marneuli District and lives there with his wife Shiran, his parents, and his grandmother who is a pensioner. His father is a construction worker and gets a service fee. Other family members are busy with the agricultural business. In particular, they are busy with farming. They have their own 0.25 hectare of land and 1.25 hectare of rented land, where they grow cabbage, watermelon, tomatoes, beans and peppers. They work hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 lari.
Artur requested a loan for cultivating the agricultural land. After cultivation and fertilization, the family hopes to get a better harvest than it was last year. A good quality harvest will be sold for a good price. As a result of this loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions. Artur hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land

loans.name: Luis Edalio

texts.es:
Luis Eladio tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en san Miguel provincia de bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Luis Eladio se dedica a la agricultura  ala siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora, alverja, además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, borregos, gallonas. Solicita el crédito para compra de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes, abonos y ganado vacuno. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado y aumentar las crías. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en san Miguel 

El sueño es poder dar el estudio a los hijos, Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son problemas de enfermedades y la falta de dinero.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y pasear.
texts.en:
Luis Eladio is 49 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his wife and son in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Luis Eladio is a farmer who grows corn, beans, blackberries, and peas. In addition he raises cattle, pigs, sheep, and chickens. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops such as fertilizers and composts, as well as cattle. With the help of this loan, he will be able to acquire cattle and increase his farming output. His purchases and sales are conducted in San Miguel.

Luis dreams of providing for his son’s education. His challenges include dealing with illnesses and the lack of money.

In his free time, Luis enjoys practicing sports and going for walks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and cattle.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Charity has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general items. 
To help expand her business, Charity has requested a loan of three million Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her business stock and will help Charity to generate greater profits. Charity hopes that in the future she will be able to carry all essential goods in her shop. 
Charity is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charity who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: increase her business stock

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children.
Merceline is a very hard working person who decided to start a medical clinic. She began with a small pharmacy, which then continued growing.
She says that in her business there is a lot of competition but she has a good client base. The service that offered the clinic also helps her. Her dream is to leave a profitable business to her three children who are still living with her and to be able to carry forward a legacy of working life.
She is requesting the loan to purchase medications to supply her business and continue offering a variety to her customers.
Her husband, a driver, provides her with other sources of income.

loans.use: to purchase medications to supply her business

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly tiene una tienda donde vende  al detalle ranchos, víveres, refrescos, carnes etc. en su barrio es muy conocida y su clientela es permanente, porque ella se esmera en ofrecerles un servicio de calidad. Su experiencia data desde hace 20 años, cuando vivía con su marido, pues tenían este mismo negocio., pero cuando se separaron, ella debió buscar alternativa de generar ingresos suficientes para atender a sus 8 hijos que hoy están en las edades de 29 a 41 años.  Inició vendiendo rifas en casa de apuestas y desde hace 3 años   le regalaron una vitrina y posteriormente teniendo en cuenta que su casa está ubicada en una esquina, se le ocurrió instalar una tienda, comprar una estantería de segunda, aprovechando que existía esa oportunidad y con unos ahorros que había logrado hacer, la surtió con los víveres de mayor rotación, aunque eran muy poco capital de trabajo, con la ayuda de su hija, quien la atendía, mientras Marly seguía trabajando en la venta de rifas; así  logró comprar su primer enfriador y poco a poco ha ido surtiéndola aun mas, todo ha sido fruto de su esfuerzo, dedicación y experiencia; hoy su tienda es reconocida en su barrio y en los alrededores y requiere un congelador, porque necesita comprar carnes en mayor volumen y adicionar pescados como un nuevo producto de su oferta, pero no tiene donde conservarlas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un congelador. Su inversión proyecta ser exitosa en tanto su experiencia en el crecimiento gradual de su negocio así lo muestran, también tendrá un nuevo producto para la venta en su haber, que es demandado por su clientela y porque logrará disminuir el costo del transporte de la carne, producto que debe comprar diariamente pues no tiene como conservarlo.  La meta de Marly es el crecimiento de su negocio y con ello lograr el incremento de sus ingresos, para continuar ofreciéndole bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Marly thas a store where she sells boxed lunches, groceries, beverages, meat, etc. wholesale. In her neighborhood she is well known and her customers are regulars because she works hard to offer then quality service. She started this business 20 years ago when she lived with her husband, because he had the same type of business. When they separated, she had to look for an alternative to generate enough income to support her 8 children who now are aged 29 to 41. She started selling raffle tickets at a gaming house. Three years ago she was given a display case and later, thinking that her house is on a corner, it occurred to her to open a store. She bought some second hand shelves, taking advantage of the fact that this opportunity existed. With some savings she was able to get together, she stocked her store  with the most popular items, although she had very little working capital. With the help of her daughter, who tended the store while Marly kept working selling raffle tickets, she was able to buy her first refrigerated case and little by little she has stocked her store more. Everything has been due to her hard work, dedication and experience. Today her store is well known in the neighborhood and beyond. She needs a freezer, because she needs to buy meats wholesale and add fish as a new product to offer. She doesn't have anywhere to keep them. That is the reason she is asking for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a freezer. Her investment is projetced to be succcesful due to her experience and the gradual growth that her business has had. She will also have a new product to sell that is in demand with the customers. She will also lower the cost of transporting the meat, since she has to buy it daily because she doesn't have anywhere to keep it. Marly's goal is the growth of her business and with that increasing her earnings, to continue offering her family wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Roselyn is selling household items in her local community. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more household items, such as rice pots and basins, to resell.
Roselyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more household items to resell

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en: Gracelyn, married, is 35 years old and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Gracelyn operates a fishing business venture, selling fish while her husband fishes for a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. In 2011, Gracelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Gracelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito” del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, cuatro hijos y solo uno a su cargo.
Lleva trabajando 3 años con Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, negocio que está surtiendo cada vez que saca un préstamo, su híjo le ayuda en la atención cuando está ocupada haciendo los quehaceres del hogar.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de detergente, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 caja de mayonesa, 1 paquete de sal, 1 caja de ayudin, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, ½ docena de milo,  1 tira de enjuague, 3 kilos de menestras, 1 kilo de chuño, 1 paquete de harina, 6 casilleros de huevo, ½ caja de conservas.
Espera que Manuela Ramos le siga facilitando los préstamos  para seguir creciendo en su negocio y para mejorar la economía de su hogar, de esa manera ayuda a su esposo que tiene un taller de cerrajería.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito” in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has four children, but only one is under her care.

Maritza has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. She has a small store in her house. Her business is restocked every time she receives a loan. Her son helps with looking after the store whenever she is busy with the household chores.

With this new loan of 3,000 PEN she will buy one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one case of oil, one case of milk, one packet of detergent, one case of small milk cans, one case of mayonnaise, one packet of salt, one case of cleaning products, five packets of toilet paper, ½ dozen containers of malt powder, one strip of hair rinse packets, three kilos of dried vegetables, one kilo of freeze-dried potatoes, one packet of flour, six crates of eggs, and ½ case of preserves.

Maritza hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue facilitating loans so that she can continue to grow her business and improve her household finances. In this manner she hopes to help her husband, who operates a locksmith shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para mantener con más variedad el negocio, comprándose ropa, calzado, y otros productos que le sirvan para ofrecer a los clientes, esto le ayudara a seguir trabajando y poder crecer en el mercado.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo tambien con el negocio, invirtiéndolo en mercadería, teniendo más oportunidades de venta por la diversidad de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan in order to sustain more variety in her business. She will buy clothing, shoes, and other products to offer to her customers. This will help her continue working so that she can grow in the marketplace.

She considers her previous loan to be a help to her business. The money was invested in merchandise, which gave her more opportunities to sell since she had a variety of products to offer.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es: Osmar de 29 años de edad vive en San Jacinto, municipio tradicionalmente conocido, por la elaboración de hermosas  hamacas y mochilas en tejido vertical. Allí vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad, a quien sueña ver convertido en una persona de éxito. Osmar es un estudiante trabajador en su propio negocio, donde se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de celulares, actividad que aprendió hace 5 años en la ciudad de Cartagena. Osmar conoce este oficio como muy pocos en su pueblo, por eso su negocio funciona y siempre está ocupado con su clientela. Su meta es comprar al por mayor repuestos y accesorios para la venta y posicionar su negocio con el fin de lograr finalizar sus estudios. Inicialmente se presentaron inconvenientes porque no se había dado a conocer, pero su campaña de buen servicio y la promoción voz a voz de cada cliente que queda satisfecho es su mayor fortaleza. Su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para hacer crecer su negocio y este es justamente lo que se propone poco a poco al buscar apoyo con un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará repuestos, accesorios y una vitrina. Con esta inversión planea impactar a su clientela, genera una imagen de negocio y subir un escalón mas para el logro de su meta en la escalera del èxito.
texts.en:
Osmar is 29 years old and lives in San Jacinto, a town traditionally known for the making of beautiful hammocks and packs in a vertical weave. There he lives with his partner and 6 year old child, whom he dreams to see become a successful person. 

Osmar is a student worker with his own business. He makes a living by maintaining and repairing cell phones, a trade that he learned five years ago in the city of Cartagena. Osmar knows this skill like very few in his town. As such, his business functions and he is always busy with his clientele. 

His goal is to buy spare parts and accessories at wholesale to sell and to position his business to achieve completion of his studies. Initially, inconveniences presented themselves because he was not well known but his campaign of good service and the word of mouth promotion of each customer that left satisfied are his greatest strengths. 

His greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital to make his business grow. This is justly what he proposes to do little by little by seeking support with a Kiva loan. This is the first financing that the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo makes to him, with which Osmar will buy spare parts, accessories and a shopfront. With this investment he plans to impress his clientele, create a business image and go one step further for the attainment of his goal in the ladder of success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, accessories and a shopfront.

loans.name: Matilde Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina tiene  51años D. edad, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en una zona llamada Lagunas al norte D. Perú. Florentina cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma el cual a podido cosolidar en parte gracias al credito anterior que obtuvo con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva. Gracias a su esfuerzo ella a desarrollado una buena reputacion con sus vecinos ofreciendo en venta diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella tambien cria animales en su domicilio.

Dada la creciente demanda por los productos de la bodega Florentina piensa que es una buena oportunidad para seguir mejorando su negocio. Por eso, ella ve la posibilidad de obtener un credito de 3000 soles con Edpyme Alternativa como algo que el ayudara con este proporsito; comprará mas mercancia como arroz, leche gaseosas y golosinas  Florentina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño, quien demonstro gran responsabilidad en el prestamo anterior.
texts.en:
Florentina is 51 years old and has her own home in the District of Lagunas in northern Peru. She has a store that she manages from her house. Florentina has been able to strengthen her business, thanks in part to the previous loan she obtained Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva. As a result of her efforts, Florentina has developed a good reputation among her neighbors for offering a variety of everyday products, including basic necessities and groceries. She also raises animals from her home.

Given the growing demand for products in her store, Florentina sees this as a good opportunity to continue improving her business. For this reason, she is obtaining a loan of 3,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa as a means of implementing her proposal. She will buy more merchandise such as rice, milk, sodas, and candy. Florentina is a hardworking woman who is of very sound character. The people who know her have much respect and affection for her. She demonstrated great responsibility with her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a hard-working woman. She always tries to do the best for her family. She has a child and loves him very much. 

For one year she has been busy with making dresses for women. She has many customers, most of whom are happy with her work. Dilorom's lovely husband helps her in her business. He buys cloth from the market and brings it to Dilorom so that she can make wonderful dresses. Dilorom is successful in her business. She is asking for a loan to buy cloth for making dresses and to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth for making dresses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, debido a que ha recibido muy buenos resultados en el negocio, estará surtiendo la tienda de más boquitas, lácteos, granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, entre otros que son muy necesarios para mantener los niveles de inventario.
Con el préstamo anterior logro realizar una buena compra, con la que se ha mantenido hasta el momento, agregando productos nuevos para satisfacer la clientela, continua con el objetivo de poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth decided to request a new loan because she has experienced very good results with her business. She will be able to restock her store with more snack foods, dairy products, basic grains, soap, detergents, and other items that she needs to maintain her inventory levels.

With her previous loan, she was able to make a good purchase and maintain her business just as before. She added new products to satisfy her customers. Elizabeth continues to pursue her goal of making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, dairy products, basic grains, soap, detergents, and other items.

loans.name: Mashraf

texts.ru: Машраф воспитанный образованный человек, он женат и воспитывает троих детей. Машраф и его семья, кроме сына живет в одной квартире с 1989 года и на сегодняшний день квартира требует небольшого ремонта. Сын живет отдельно со своей семьей, имеет земельный участок, где строит дом . Двое  являются студентами, учатся в ВУЗ-ах города Душанбе. Жена работает врачом центральной районной больнице. Машраф хочет отремонтировать свой дом и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони.
texts.en: Mashraf is an education and civilized man, he is married and is raising three children. Mashraf and his family have been living in the same apartment since 1989 and it requires a small amount of repairs. His son lives separately with his family and has a plot of land where he is planning to build a house. The two other children are still students and are studying in colleges in Dushanbe. Mashraf's wife works as a doctor at the regional hospital. Mashraf wants to borrow 4000 somoni to repair their apartment.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа замужняя женщина, воспитывает четверых детей. Она  работает в средней школе. Она учительница, преподает уроки биологии. Её зарплата хватает только на содержание семьи и она хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия  и с этой целью запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Её муж в трудовой  миграции в Российской Федерации. Она и её дети очень надеются на вашу помощь и доброту, что поможет создать уют и комфорт в доме.
texts.en:
