Ahmet is from Kosovo. He is married and is the father of five children. He lives in a village and the main source of income for the family is from livestock. 

Ahmet wants to expand his farm, but he lacks the necessary funds. This loan will help him and his family to purchase a cow. It is important for Ahmet to increase the number of cows and to have a chance to sell more milk and milk products and generate more income. This will help him to cover his family's costs and to ensure financial stability for them.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 48 years old and married with eight children. For the past three years, she has operated a medical clinic and offers her services to customers with low incomes. Violet is also a community health worker and used a previous loan from Faulu Kenya to open her clinic. 

Violet is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to buy medicines and a microscope. In the future, she dreams of uplifting the standards of her clinic.

loans.use: to buy medicines and a microscope

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 27 years old and has two children. She operates a retail shop in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Besides that, she operates a mechanic outlet where she generates extra income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her saving skills because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business and became prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 32-year-old business lady living in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop from where she sells animal feed and fertilizer; a business which she has been doing for one year.

Besides this, Jemima has previously been in the taxi business. She had briefly stopped the transport business but has picked up once again and now has two taxis.

Jemima learnt of Milango from an employee and is requesting a loan for 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed and fertilizer. The main challenge in the business is high fuel cost and some clients not paying on time.

Her goal is to have a working capital of one million Kenya shillings in the near future and be a major transporter.

loans.use: To to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is involved in the transport industry. He was first employed in a touring company from which he saved money to purchase a van.

Ali was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access funding for his business. He is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase vehicle tires and carry out body work on his van to attract tourists.

His ambitions include owning more touring vans and finally establishing a touring company.  The additional income from this loan will help him in the future with emergency needs. He will use the extra income to purchase fuel and other operations.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires and carry out body work on his van.

loans.name: Ishabella

texts.en:
Ishabella is 37 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Ishabella has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells essential items such as sugar and flour. 

To help expand her business, Ishabella is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more sugar, soap, and other items. Her loan will help Ishabella to generate greater profits and to increase her income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Ishabella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ishabella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap, and other items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old single mother of two children ages 12 and 22. She started a tailoring business six years ago and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

Jane is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase cloth material to tailor and sell. This will be her sixth loan. Jane will reinvest her profits back into her business. In the future, she hopes to succeed in life and expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase material to make dresses

loans.name: Nadduli

texts.en:
Nadduli is 37 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Nadduli has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells dresses, skirts, and sweaters. 

To help expand his business, Nadduli is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more materials. His loan will help him to generate greater profits and increase his income. Nadduli hopes that in the future he will be able to be self-reliant. 

Nadduli is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nadduli who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothing

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 50 years old, single and has no children. Even though this can often be seen as a negative situation where she is from, she has demonstrated her will to prosper and work hard. Indeed, this is now the second loan Fanny takes from Edpyme Alternative with the support of Kiva, having had a good experience her first time around.

She lives in her own house, with her mother in the district of Tambogrande, Northern Peru. They do not have the basic services of  water or electricity in her community. Fanny has two main sources of income. On the one hand, she sells cosmetics which has proven a succesful idea. On the other hand, she also has a small crop of lemons, which she takes care of with the help of her nephews. She is now looking for a loan of 1,500 to keep on expanding her cosmetics business and to buy compost for her lemon plants. She proved to be a responsible client and was prompt paying her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her cosmetics business and to buy compost for her lemon plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional motorcycle due to increase in the number of clients.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.en: Roberto is an experienced moto-taxi driver, 30 years old, from a rural area called Olmos in Northern Peru. His type of work is very important to connect people with the main areas of the region. He lives in a small rural community of around 70 houses with his wife and 5-year-old child. This system provides a cheap and efficient way for people to be able to reach distant communities and provides his family with a key income stream. He is now asking for a loan of 2000 soles, which he will use to repair the tires of his motor vehicle, do general maintenance to it, as well as to sort out some leaks in his tin roof.

loans.use: repair the tires of his motor vehicle and repair some leaks in his tin roof

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie, 37 years old, is married and lives in Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Rosie operates a transportation business, using a trisikad (pedicab), for a living. She's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Rosie has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Rosie wants to make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en: Maria Rosa is 58 years old, married, with one child. They live in a small town called Morropón in Northern Peru. Within their humble house, she has set up a small shop where she sells different products like rice, vegetables, milk or sugar. She has proven her micro-entrepreneurial spirit by identifying that opportunity and taking action. As a result of the success of her shop, she feels it is time to make certain changes to it. In particular she wants to make the shop bigger and offer a wider range of products. Hence, she is taking a loan with Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva of 2513 soles (which includes transport cost incurred) to carry out this expansion. She has very good personal references within her community. This is of course no coincidence, as her hard work and ability to put into practice her ideas pay off with a good reputation.

loans.use: To increase the size of her shop and buy goods to increase the range of products on offer

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a 50-year-old married mom of 2 children. She is living in Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 25 years of age until the present time. She normally receives PHP 7,000 a month. In 2011, Perlita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets realized, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is married. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Florencia is a farmer and she operates a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for fifteen years and every month she earns PHP 8,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Florencia has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, es una persona muy emprendedora, reconocida por la comunidad, vive con sus dos hijos, de 19 y 18 años de edad, ambas estudian el bachillerato y son dependientes de ella, María es viuda se dedica a atender un negocio en la venta de comida y productos de consumo, esto lo aprendió por la necesidad económica, lo realiza con sus hijas desde hace 5 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica, para surtir la tienda creando más oportunidades de obtener ingresos, invertirá por ejemplo en: Pastas, embutidos, boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, que son los más comunes en los negocios, ya que cuentan con la mayor demanda. Esta inversión le proporcionara un negocio más amplio y surtido, que le ayudara a mejorar el servicio con los clientes, dándole mayores ventas,  para sus condiciones de vida tanto personales como de sus hijas, en este negocio el riesgo son las variaciones de los precios en los productos y la competencia.
El objetivo de María es seguir luchando y trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones económicas, tambien quiere apoyar a sus hijas con la alimentación debida y la educación, para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
María is a very enterprising person who is recognized by her community.  She lives with her two children, who are 19 and 18 years old and who are both in high school.  They are both her dependents.  María is a widow who tends to her business selling food and food products.  She learned how to run her business due to economic need and she has been doing it for five years now with her daughters.

She is asking for a loan to buy staple products to stock her business and to create more opportunities to generate earnings. She will invest in things such as pastas, canned goods, snack foods, cookies, sodas, rice, beans, sugar, and salt, which are the most common things found in businesses like hers because they are the most in demand.  This investment will make her business bigger and better stocked, which will help her improve the service she offers her customers.  This will make more sales for her that will help with the quality of life of both her and her daughters.  The risks in her business are the fluctuation of the prices of her products and the competition.

María's goal is to keep fighting and working to improver her financial situation.  She also wants to support her daughters with good nutrition and an education so they have the academic training they need.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, cookies, sodas, rice, beans, rice, and salt

loans.name: Mujembere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyota  est une veuve  courageuse. Agée  de 60 ans, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés;  est au 6ème cycle dans son groupe de crédit Munjembere.  Elle est vendeuse des boissons sucrées  depuis 2009 après le décès de son mari. Elle compte acheter  60 caisses des boissons sucrées avec le crédit sollicité  pour la croissance  de son affaire tout en souhaitant avoir un  dépôt  dans l’avenir. Elle remercie Hekima pour ces prêts et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en:
The client Nyota is a courageous widow. She is 60 years old, mother of five children all having attended school, and is entering her sixth loan cycle with the Munjembere credit group.

She has been selling soft drinks since 2009, following her husband's death. She plans to buy 60 cases of soft drinks with the loan she requested to expand her business, and hopes to open a store in the future.

She thanks Hekima for these loans and asks God to bless them even more.

loans.use: buy 60 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Esenbol

texts.en: Esenbol, 28, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house he owns in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife studies at a vocational training center. His children are kindergarten students. He owns an old Russian car. He was assistant driver to carry baggage after finishing his driving school in 2009. His salary makes the household income. The income he generates from his work is not sufficient for him to provide for the family. So, he wants to buy a truck that saves fuel to start his own transportation business. He is a hardworking and clever man. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a truck that saves fuel to carry baggage.

loans.use: To purchase a truck that saves fuel to carry baggage

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en: Ayub is a 27-year-old man who is married to Selmi, 27 years old. They are blessed with 2 children, Geraldit, 2 years old, and Elisda, 4 months old. Ayub works as a farmer. On the farm, he is planting cabbage and corn this season. Ayub spends 9 hours a day on his farm to take care of the plants by watering the plants, mowing the grass, spreading the fertilizer, etc. Ayub intends to buy more seedling, fertilizer and a water hose to ease his job in watering the plants. Therefore, Ayub is requesting a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase these items.

loans.use: to buy more seedling, fertilizer, and a water hose

loans.name: Eraldo Ovando

texts.es:
Eraldo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar el negocio invirtiendo en la compra de medicamentos en variedad de presentaciones y para diferentes enfermedades o padecimientos, también quiere comprarse variedad de ropa en blusas y faldas ropa interior para salir a vender, pues esto le ayudará a tener un negocio surtido y poder continuar trabajando por su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer teniendo lo necesario a su alcance, dándole continuidad a su trabajo y hasta el momento ha logrado mantener a su familia en buenas condiciones a través de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Eraldo is requesting a new loan with the intention of improving his business by investing in the purchase of medications in a variety of forms and for different sicknesses or ailments. He also wants to buy a variety of clothing including blouses, skirts and undergarments to sell. This will help him to have a stocked business and be able to continue working to support his family. 

With the previous loan he was able to grow having all that was necessary at his reach, allowing him to continue his work and up to this moment having succeeded in keeping his family in good condition through these loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine, skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por qué quiere invertir en el negocio, aumentando el inventario de la tienda que ha instalado, ya que esto le permite un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mantener su preferencia, se comprará azúcar, aceite, pastas, boquitas, jabón y detergentes, entre otros productos que son demandados por los clientes por su uso diario en el lugar.
Con el préstamo anterior logró incrementar los materiales para elaborar tortillas, esto le ha ocasionado un mejor funcionamiento con sus clientes, ya que sus ventas han sido buenas, su negocio está cambiando volviéndose más rentable, ya que tiene establecida una tienda, venta de bebidas y las tortillas, gracias al crédito de kiva considera que está prosperando con su familia.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she wants to invest in her business by bolstering the inventory of the store she set up.  This will allow her to offer her customers better service and it will allow her to keep what they want in stock.  She will buy sugar, oil, pastas, snack foods, soap, and detergents, among other products her customers demand for their daily use.

With her previous loan, she was able to get more supplies to make tortillas, which has allowed them to better serve their customers.  As their sales have been good, her business has been changing and becoming more successful now that she has set up a storefront where she sells drinks and tortillas.  She believes that it is because of the Kiva loan that she and her family are prospering.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pastas, snack foods, soap, and detergents

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen (50) is married to Nurlin (39) and they are blessed with 4 children, Olmi (15), Viran (11), Yakob (9) and Retwi (5). All are attending school. 
Marthen has been running a kiosk business for more than 11 years. It is adjacent to his house. He sells household items like bath soap, detergent, biscuits, cigarettes, soft drinks, and cakes. Due to the increase in his children's schooling expenses, Marthen is thinking of improving his business in order to generate more income by selling rice in bulk. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk to be resold

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera que son muchas las facilidades de crecimiento que obtiene a través de él, está en el proceso agrícola y para esto deberá invertir en abonos e insecticidas, ya que iniciará la siembra en una manzana de terreno, también deberá preparar las hortalizas, considera que a través de estos préstamos está logrando obtener buenos resultados.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo un incremento en sus cosechas debido a la inversión realizada, con materiales que aplica al momento de la siembra, esto le generó ganancias por la venta de la cosecha ayudando a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones haciéndolas más favorables.
texts.en:
Rafael is asking for a new loan, as he believes that it will offer him many opportunities for growth.  He works in farming and so he has to invest in fertilizers and insecticides, as he will start planting a plot of land.  He also has to prepare his produce.  He believes that he is getting good results through the use of these loans.

With his last loan his yield increased because of the investment he made in supplies that are used at the time of planting.  This generated earnings for him through sales of his produce, which helped to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a 34-year-old widow. She has three children. Abdul, 17, is in the 3rd grade of junior high school; Jefriyanto, 16, is in the 2nd grade of senior high school; Firanti, 13, is in the 1st grade of junior high school. 
Maimuna is a hardworking woman. Since the death of her husband several years ago, she strives to better cover her family’s living cost. In the morning, she sells vegetables at the market and after that, she continues to run the kiosk business at home. Maimuna admitted that she needs extra capital to stock the kiosk with more products and one of her neighbors suggested that she borrow the money from TLM. She is happy to request a loan of IDR 3,000,000. She would like to use the loan to purchase coffee, milk, tea, eggs, soap, shampoo, detergent, snacks, instant noodles, and fresh drink.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, milk, tea, eggs, soap, shampoo, detergent, snacks, instant noodles, and fresh drinks for her kiosk.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, Uganda. He is married and has two children of which one is currently in school. For the past five years, Sharif has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Sharif has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his sales, and will help Sharif generate greater profits. Sharif hopes to become the richest man in the village in the future. 

Sharif is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharif who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too big for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his clothing sales.

loans.name: Lexy

texts.en:
Lexy is a 20-year-old single man who is living with his parents and his 10-year-old sister. After graduating from high school one year ago, Lexy decided to start a kiosk business. As the oldest son, Lexy is responsible to support his parents in generating income for their daily needs. He spent his own money to buy kiosk stock. He sells daily-use basic items e.g., instant noodle, biscuits, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc.
 
Lately, Lexy has been thinking of adding more stock to his kiosk such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, and cooking oil and he also wants to sell petrol and mobile phone recharge. He needs capital assistance to do so. Lexy then met a loan officer and received some information about the TLM lending program. He is interested in joining TLM and requested a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to implement his plan.

loans.use: to add more kiosk stock and to buy petrol and mobile phone recharge

loans.name: Jessica Paulina

texts.es:
JESSICA PAULINA tiene 27 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

JESSICA PAULINA es administrador en un cyber. Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador, impresora. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el computador para digitar los trabajos que hace. La compra la efectuará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es poder salir del país para conocer otro ambiente. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y leer.
texts.en:
Jessica Paulina is 27 years old, she is single and she has no children. She lives with her parents in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Jessica Paulina is the manager of an Internet café. She is requesting a loan to buy a computer and a printer.

Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy a computer to organize the things she does. She will buy it in the town of Guaranda.

She dreams of going out of her country to visit new places. In her free time she very much likes listening to music and reading.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Sara Noemi

texts.es:
SARA NOEMI tiene 52 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el conyugue, hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívra.

SARA NOEMI presta sus servicios en una institución cómo auxiliar. Solicita el crédito para pago de matrícula y comprar una lapto. Con la ayuda del crédito podra ayudar al hijo a pagar la matrícula de la universidad y comprar el computador.

La compra lo hara en Guaranda y el pago de la matrícula lo hará en Quito. El sueño es poder tener la posibilidad de terminar la casa y ver a los hijos profesionales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es conservar el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y compartir momentos de juego y diverción con los hijos.
texts.en:
Sara Noemi is 52 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children. She lives with her partner and their children in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Sara Noemi works as an assistant in an institution. She is requesting a loan to pay registration fees and to buy a laptop. Thanks to the loan she will be able to help her son with the payment of his university registration fees and to buy a computer.

She will buy the computer in Guaranda, while she will pay registration fees in Quito. She dreams of succeeding in finishing building her house and to see her children become professionals.

The challenge she has to face is keeping her job. In her free time she likes Reading and sharing games and funny moments with her children.

loans.use: To pay registration fees and to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Im is 42 years old and lives in one of the remote areas of the Kandal province.  She is the mother of four children.  One of her children works at the garment factory, another two run a tiny grocery store and the fourth still attends school. 

Her primary source of income to support this entire family is her mat weaving business.  She has been in business for 10 years and can earn about 13,000 KHR per day.  This is Im's fourth loan cycle with KIVA's partner, VisionFund.  She has successfully repaid her past three loans in full.  The previous loans have enabled her to improve her living conditions and she is able to manage both the daily expenses and keep her children in school.  

Now she has formed a group with another member to apply for a loan.  As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy the reed necessary for weaving mats.  She hopes to produce a lot of mats so as to generate more income for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy the reed necessary for weaving mats.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Josie is selling Tupperware in their local community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more Tupperware to resell.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of tupperware to resell.

loans.name: Tilek

texts.en:
Tilek, 28, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house on the land he owns in Bayanulgii province, Mongolia. His two children are kindergarten students. He runs a handicraft business making Dombor (kazakh traditional musical instrument). His wife helps with his business. He is well known to the locals. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. The income he generates from his business is enough for his family. 

He wants to build a garden on the land he owns. He also wants to expand his business. He is a hardworking and clever man. He says "I want to build my own factory by expanding my business"  He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to buy some trees, lawn and flower seeds to make a garden.

loans.use: To buy some trees, lawn and flower seeds.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania es socia del banco comunal “Fruto Bendito”, del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.
Son tres años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, tiene un moto car con el cual brinda servicio de taxi, su hijo es el que lo maneja por las mañanas antes de ir al colegio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: un juego de llantas, 2 cámaras y aceite.
Su esposo es trabajador independiente y es el encargado de pagar todos los gastos de su hogar, el ingreso de su movilidad es un extra para la casa con él se cubren algunos gastos imprevistos y felizmente tiene la ayuda de uno de sus hijos.
Espera que toda las socias de su banco paguen puntualmente para que puedan seguir trabajando sin ningún problema, está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Fruto Bendito”, which is located in the District of Manantay in the Department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.

Tania has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. She has a motorcycle taxi that she uses for providing transportation services. Her son drives the vehicle in the mornings before he goes to school. With her new loan of 1,000 PEN, Tania will buy a set of tires, two inner tubes, and oil.

Her husband is a self-employed worker and is in charge of paying for all of the household expenses. The income from her taxi service provides extra household income for unforeseen expenses. Fortunately she has help from one of her children.

Tania hopes that all of the members of her Communal Bank pay on time so that they can continue working without any problems. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy a set of tires, two inner tubes, and oil.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is 31 years old and lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. As the breadwinner of the family of two kids who are still in school, she has been farming on one hectare of farmland as her main income for nine years and working in a factory as additional income for six years. She can earn about 10 US Dollars per day, but she is able to save about 4 US Dollars. 

This is the first loan for Nary with VisionFund and she is requesting a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy fertilizers, seeds, and a cow for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy quantities of rice and earn more profits so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and a cow for her farmland.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Kesiah is married and blessed with three children aged 13, five and three years. She cooks and sells food, a business she started seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested for a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more utensils and a Meko gas for efficient services. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and support her family’s needs. Her dream is to educate her children as well as lead a better life.

loans.use: To puchase more utensils to serve her customers and a meko gas for efficient cooking.

loans.name: Noost

texts.en:
Noost, 56, lives with his wife and his two children in a small house he owns in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife is retired. His daughter is a college teacher. Also he works as a college teacher. He wants to run an agriculture business with his son. 

Last year, he bought 1,5 hectares of land. He is planning to plant some organic vegetables on the land. He is a humble and diligent man. He says " I want to improve my family's livelihood by planting vegetables."  He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy organic vegetable seeds for his new business.

loans.use: To buy organic vegetable seeds for his new business.

loans.name: Jescel

texts.en:
Jescel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 
Jescel sells snacks in her community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks, like flour, sugar, and cheese.
Jescel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Kasao

texts.en:
Kasao is 37 years old and married. He supports a family of eight children. He is a maize farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

He is servicing his 4th loan of KES 40,000 from KADET and this will facilitate him in preparing the farm and purchasing inputs. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Aida Beatriz

texts.es:
AIDA BEATRIZ tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos en casa de unos familiares en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.

AIDA BEATRIZ es asistente de limpieza, Solicita el crédito para comprar medicina y pago de consulta. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la medicina. 

La compra lo hará en una farmacia de Guaranda. El sueño es poder tener salud, estabilidad laboral y ayudar a la familia.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es salir adelante en el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta tejer y compartir momentos agradables con la familia.
texts.en:
Aida Beatriz is 47 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children. She lives with her partner and their children in the house of a relative in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province.

Aida Beatriz is an assistant cleaner. She is requesting a loan to buy medicines and to pay for medical consultation. Thanks to the loan she will be able to buy the medicines she needs.

She will buy the medicines in a pharmacy of Guaranda. She wishes to enjoy good health, to have working stability and to her her family.

The challenge she has to face is to progress with her job. In her free time she likes weaving and to share pleasant moments with her family.

loans.use: To buy medicines and to pay for medical consultation.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Chona has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Chona became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Chona hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel Mesías tiene 30 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre y los familiares en san Miguel Provincia de bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Manuel Mesías se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, papas, mora, arveja además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, pollos y tiene un taller de carpintería.

Solicita el crédito para compra de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes, abonos y comprar madera, cortadora. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes.

Las compras lo hará en San Pablo. El sueño es poder comprar terreno, tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo ocasionando pérdidas. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Manuel Mesías is 30 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother and other relatives in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Manuel Mesías is a farmer who grows corn, beans, potatoes, blackberries, and peas. He also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. Manuel also manages a carpentry workshop. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. Manuel will also buy wood and a saw. He will be able to buy fertilizers with the help of this loan. His purchases will be made in San Pablo.

Manuel dreams are to buy a plot of land and to own a house. The challenges he faces include dealing with bad weather and occasional losses.

In his free time, Manuel enjoys practicing sports and going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, wood, and a saw.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 38 years of age.  She is married to Ignatius and blessed with three children, aged 16, 13, and 10 years. She practices poultry farming, a business she ventured into three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Sabina has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase broiler chicks for rearing.  Profit from her business will help repay her loan and expand her business.  She hopes to see her business grow big.

loans.use: To purchase broiler chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old, married, and blessed with two children that she supports. She has run a retail shop for the last two years, getting a monthly income of KES 19,000. 

With a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. she plans to restock her shop with a variety of products, like cooking fat, tea leaves, washing detergents etc. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into the business for expansion. Her future dreams is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jamadah

texts.en:
Jamadah is 34 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Jamadah has been working hard to manage his hardware business selling cement and other building materials. 

To help expand his business, Jamadah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cement, and will help Jamadah to generate greater profits to expand the business. Jamadah hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his income. 

Jamadah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamadah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cement.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene  is 32  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Mylene has a food/retail shop, a sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Mylene has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mylene hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 48 years old and married to Joseph, is the mother of four children between 21 and 9 years of age. For the past 11 years, she has had a tailoring business and is now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy textile materials to make outfits for her clients.

In the near future Mary hopes to become a supplier of ready-made clothes and open up a boutique.

loans.use: to buy textile materials.

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos: 4 mayores de edad y uno a su cargo.
Se dedica  a la venta  de productos de belleza por catálogo, trabaja con tres marcas de productos diferentes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 nuevos soles pagará sus productos que comprará para tener un stock aprovechando las ofertas del mes, lo que le resta de dinero lo guardará para cualquier imprevisto que tenga.    
Está muy contenta porque tiene el capital que necesitaba para poder trabajar sin ningún contratiempo, espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of of El Paraiso (The Paradise), a Communal Bank located in the Coronel Portillo district, in the De Ucayali department. She is 52 years old, she is married and she has five children, 4 of whom are independent while one is economically depend on her.
She sells beauty products by catalogue, and she works with three different product brands.
She will use a part of her new loan of 3,000 PEN to buy products to stock up her inventory, taking advantage of the offers of the month; the rest of the money will be saved to face any contingencies she might incur into.
She is very happy because she has the working capital she needed to be able to work without any setback, and she hopes to keep on working with Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize and beans for sale.
